game-hours: 327.7
review: Best game ever !
game-hours: 270.4
review: This game has an insanely high learning curve, and is unforgiving to new players. But if you have the patience to get through it, it'll all be worth it. The game is the classic tri lane MOBA, with a large roster of heroes, and the list continues to grow. This game also is completely F2P, in the purest form. No pay to win scams....period. The entire game is free, all the heroes, even the cosmetics which other f2p games would charge for you can earn by just playing the game through end of match drops. Now granted you won't be getting anything good for your first 100 or so matches. But once you get past like level 7 you're eligible for any level rarity drops including COURIERS!! Now on to the gameplay. one way this game sets itself apart from its competition is that it has a turning mechanism, in other mobas when you click the other direction your hero immediately turns and moves there. In DOTA 2, your hero will perform a full body turn, which could take some time which in turn means you could die. The game as I said earlier is unforgiving to new players, what I mean by that is when you die, you LOSE gold. Dying in MOBAs is bad enough giving enemy laner chance to free farm and gain xp, but an extra barrier for yourself isnt a good thing for the one who died, especially early laning. Another big thing NO RECALL TO BASE. Other mobas, you can simply recall to base no matter where on the map, not here. You can carry tp scrolls allowing you to tp to any ally tower, but those cost money, and go on cooldown after use (don't move while tp, trust me). And the last MAJOR thing that sets itself apart is the balance, this game has every hero become OP, meaning if any hero was placed in LoL or some other MOBA, that hero would most likely become op in that game. With every hero becoming OP in DOTA 2 there is balance. So your stuns last for like 5 seconds, your nukes CAN kill in one hit. A snowballer could mean level 25 while everyone else is still lvl 10. These things sound game breaking but somehow works very well. All in all the game is great, nothing to complain about other then unforgiving to mistakes. But if you be patient and work your way through it you'll find yourself not playing any other game much.

Valve pht hnh Dota 2 qua h thng iu phi Steam ca h m qua  tr chi c cp nht song song vi h thng phin bn DotA[7]. Thng thng, mi vn Dota 2 l mt trn u ring bit v chia lm 2 i, mi i gm 5 ngi chi v chim ng mt thnh ly  2 gc i din ca bn . Nm gia pho i mi bn l mt cng trnh gi l "Ancient" ("Thnh tch");  ginh chin thng, mt i phi ph hy thnh tch ca i i phng. Mi ngi chi ch c iu khin mt nhn vt duy nht s hu mt s kh nng chin u nht nh, phi hp cng ng i ginh li th trn bn   i ti chin thng. Cng vic pht trin Dota 2 c bt u vo nm 2009, vi vic Valve tuyn c nh pht trin "IceFrog" ca bn mod DotA lm nh thit k chnh ca ta tr chi tip ni ny. Dota 2 c khen ngi bi cc nh ph bnh tr chi in t do va gi c nt c sc ca tr tin nhim l DotA, va nng cao c cht lng tr chi, cng nh nhng cm nhn li cun, hng th m tr chi mang li. Tuy nhin Dota 2 cng b ph phn bi vic n c "ng cong hc hi" dc v cng ng ngi chi thiu thn thin. Tr chi hin l tr c chi nhiu nht trn Steam, vi lng ngi chi cng lc  nh im l 600.000.[8]

review: Well for starters, take a look at my total hours played. That should tell you how much I like this game. I honestly find the idea of a MOBA very appealing. Is DOTA 2 the best game in the world? Probably not. Is DOTA 2 the game I have spent 1000+ hours on and will probably spend another thousand on? Absolutely.

game-hours: 66.4
review: sdsadsads
game-hours: 4762.2
review: whether you believe in religion or not imagine Lucifer, this game is its materialization on earth as video game. this game is addictive for People That at some point are not mentally strong like teenagers or any other case you want. from the first game you can see that it is playing with people who have little social life, often frustrated and with much hate inside (this to be kind because in reality you can meet also true psychopaths). The game consists of two teams that are put in an arena (like a circle for cockfight) where you should defend something called "ancient" but in reality you do not enter the game to defend him but rather to destroy the opponent "ancient" killing against their will who defends him (the other players), as you can already hear the name diverts from the real purpose of the game, the game wants you to suppress your opponent at all costs (even the death of your hero which then justifies by waiting a few seconds before being reborn). all that is evil because it creates negative emotions deep that then imply that they are filled only by playing more games, in this game you do not feel good if you lose, and even if you win, if you lose you do not feel good because you were not able to overcome the challenge to fight as roosters against a person, you feel as deprived from that person and you lose everything that the game says "you should" defend as important to not know what purpose, the simple fact of losing to someone too many times can create a sense of depression as if to say that we are not able to be on par with someone and to succumb to their will, and that is where it comes hatred towards teammate, you do not agree to not being up to the game and start to blame the teammates. every time after training you will prove that you have become better and the game puts you against opponents that you are not yet up to beat and the cycle begins again.the game makers have implemented the system of ranking so as to push on this mechanism even more since the number you see written on the screen at the time indicates how much you're worth inside of their system, more you practice and the more they reward you with a number on the screen , but the fact that you play only goes as they please because keeps alive the game and they can make money over there.not even win games is rewarding because what you must do is suppress the enemy against his will and make him feel bad as you never wanted to feel when you lost the matches. they call it "free to play" because this mechanism is activated immediately, they know that probably many of the people who try the game will pay with their dedication, time and hidden deep sadness and justifying it as a passion for the game. the fact that they sell cosmetics items in the store is just another way to take advantage of weak minds not to mention the money that goes around the "pro gaming", there are tournaments with millions of dollars as a reward, and you compete on a game that is completely unbalanced, with many bugs and even less content of the first version exists for many years. in the end this is horrifying, I think I analyzed it all exhaustively.

game-hours: 1102.3
review: Great game that is free and extremely fun.
game-hours: 727.3
review: At first Dota 2 was not that engaging, because of the learning curve. Being a new comer to MOBA's in general though it was very helpful to run through the tutorial and the bot matches to get a grasp of what was going on. After you get the hang of it though, it gets highly addictive. There are a lot of possible interactions between abilities, item builds, and hero selection. Having all of the hero's to try out at your leisure is a daunting yet very encouraging option. I love that I can choose any hero, especially if you just want to run a bot match to try them out before playing with people. The community can be harsh, but it can also be very friendly. Making friends on Dota can be easy. They throw quite a few seasonal events which are a lot of fun. I love the art work and hero artistic design. I can't believe that this game is free to play. They do offer quite a few amazing cosmetics, like a portal pack for purchase. You get to hear GlaDos announce the match, which is very entertaining. I highly recommend playing the game and spending time with it. I would say the first 60 hours you play is all learning experience. Consider that you have 107 current heros to play, each hero will take you at least 3 rounds to really get a hang of (not just by yourself, but with your team and hero selections, item builds, etc.) Each round is about 20 - 45 minutes. Which it is a good thing to play with a variety of heros to begin with just to learn what they can do. One last point to mention, the hero's are well balanced. In public games there seems to be defined favorites, but by no means are they over powered. By far this is one of my favorite games.

review: The Sequel to the most popular MOBA (Multiplayer Online Battle Arena) game, DotA is just interesting and really better then its prequel. DotA 2 has more than 2 Million Players from all around the world. The game has 107 Playable Heroes from which only 10 Battle Against each other in a Game. Additionally creeps are left out for Farming and Leveling Up. Creeps make the game a lot Intelligent and Improved and make players feel like they are playing with more than 10 players, an expectation more than what is true. As my thoughts, the game is just a awesome piece of art. I never got a chance to play the prequel of the game, that's DotA, but have seen my brother play it. At first, I was thinking DotA 2 will be a fail for action loving players like me. But now, I have played it over 100 Hours. I don't even see my Steam Library. Only run DotA 2, play with my teammates and wait to join Tournaments for Prizes and Victories. I hope, you liked my small and pretty review, I will be writing more reviews all along the Steam Website. Ratings - Connection (Server Response) - 9.7 | Graphics - 9 | Gameplay - 10 | Interface - 10 | Sound - 8.7 | Overall - 9.4

game-hours: 740.9
review: Dota 2 is like driving a car. (They have similar intensity) You have to look at minimap like wing mirrors You have to look at chat like looking rear-view mirror The more intense game becomes, is like the more you drive into big city or complex places in rush hours The less you know about what each hero can do or how the game play, is like not knowing roads/streets or even shortcuts ****If you dont care about winning (zero percent), then it is like you driving a trashy car and crash to other cars and you simply run away. (You just might got caught)***** The game is full of possibilty and it is well balanced. But it's just that most people just like to driving to some same places rather than the rest of the places because it's easier reach the destination without stress.

game-hours: 1633.8
review: This game is much better than the Warcraft mod Dota 1 sequel. Many improvements had been added. Rare bugs, and sometimes a bit too laggy. It's always up-to-date so to speak. A good environment because you get to play with other countries as well. Unlike Dota 1, you can only play at your country because connections are limited. Graphics is awesome, the hero designs are cool, the music gave me goosebumps. But what bothers me is the end-game drop items that an individual gets, it should be improved, like increase the chance of getting an item, and fix the servers especially in SEA. Overall, I truly love this game. Because it requires a lot of teamwork and communication in order to win. For me this is the best Free-to-Play game on Steam.

review: This is a good game. For a MOBA type of game, i think it works very well. Firstly the gameplay is sufficiently complicated such that items and abilities do not always have to follow the standard path, many aspects of the game is situational. At the same time, the game is fun and relies heavily on strategising and execution. Playing online is great as it is a real test of skill and strategy. It must be noted however, that the online community tends to be unfriendly at times (as with most online games, especially this type). The customization of the heroes in game is a nice touch and i like it. Especially since it helps ensure that this game is totally f2p.

game-hours: 305.3
review: This is an AMAZING game. Ill run down some good things and bad things Good things: All heroes are free, so there isn't anything like pay 2 win or something like in Legue of Legends. All heroes are balanced, and yeah there are some really good heroes too, but that's in every game. There are a lot of different game modes, and some even where you can make your own hero! There's a mute and report button so that you can report very anoying people, since it's a full on team game. You can get free items by winning. These are fully cosmetic, but are really cool! just like in many other steam games, you can sell those items and make money! I've made a few dollars, so it's not to mutch, but just a small extra. There's a bot mode where you can train new heroes. Bad things: The players are many times anoying. (But then there's the mute and report button) There arn't a LOT of heroes, but plenty. Language detector doesn't work (wich means you will play with a lot of people that speak a differnt language than you) If you play with friends that are a higher lvl than you, you will get to play in that high lvl too, wich will be really hard. That was basicly it. I reallly like this FREE TO PLAY game, i've got 280 hours of play time in to it, but ill shurely play it a lot more

game-hours: 1152.5
review: I was going to do a review about 700 hours ago but decided to take more time into the game before sharing my opinion. Now i do believe this game is the most amazing game i have ever played and i have never put so much time and effort into this game. There are some negatives about this game though. Lets get the good things first Good -There is one map in the game but it never gets old. -The amount of heroes there are to choose from -The customization you can do to your characters -It is not a pay to win game. Its just for customization and to make you look badass. -The amount of satisfaction you get for having an amazing game. -The amount of communication you need to succeed in this game. -Its a very balanced game with nothing that really screams cheap (I know about PA's and Slarks but still, they are the easiest thing to counter) -The constant amount of updates that happen Bad (Things you need to get over before having the best experience) -The learning curve in this game is huge. If you have never played a MOBA, like myself, then your first 20-30 hours will be the hardest hours because you are getting used to playing. -The people that troll or who tend to give you a bad experience in the game which happens rarley -Some of the characters are a little dull (don't really intrest people) I highly recommend this game to anyone that wants a game that needs communication, strategy, and thinking to win. If you come from League of Legends, you will be bad at this game, but when you play more, you will love it more.

(no preference on either game, I think bot of them are good) Give this game a try, the learning curve is very steep but it is rewarding when you learn. I think this is the best gave valve has ever developed and has been the most played game on steam ever since the second year of beta development. Try it out, its free and badass!

review: Had a friend who played this game a lot. Got along with him well for a few years. I played this for a few hours and it's a total troll-fest. Nerve-wracking how terrible the community is in this game. It is not worth the price of free. One mistake early and you lose the whole game, but it takes about an hour for that loss to happen. So during that time you are forced to play a losing game or get penalties for quitting. Anyhow, my friend played this non-stop for a few years. Turned him into a totally rude nutbar to the point that I unfriended the prick. I think the community of this game rotted him out, luckily I never met him in real life. That would be sad, to see a real life friend get degraded into an animal before you. This game is toxic, I played enough online games to see this right away. Stay away, this is a money-making machine for Valve with psychological side-effects not worth the 'free' price-tag on the game.

review: I had a good time playing this game. Every other review of this game says that it ruined the reviewer's life and gave them, I quote, 'erectile disfunction, knowledge of many other languages, the ability to be massively racist and social anxiety disorder'. No, this is not true. I played my first few games ,and whilst the community is appalling, managed to learn the basics. After a few more hours I had learnt to play fairly well and maintained my erectile functionality and friendships. Also, it is a free game so give it a go. If you find an item, you can sell it for money. However, I will have to warn you that in many of your early games you will be matched with horrible people who will insult you and speak Russian. Ignore this, improve and help others.

game-hours: 552.2
review: 8 tablespoons (1 stick) unsalted butter, plus more for pan 5 tablespoons all-purpose flour, plus more for pan 1/2 cup whole hazelnuts, toasted 1 1/4 cups confectioners' sugar, plus more for dusting 1 Pinch of salt 4 large egg whites 1/4 teaspoon pure vanilla extract DIRECTIONS STEP 1 Heat oven to 325 degrees. In a small saucepan, melt butter until light amber in color. STEP 2 Brush madeleine pan with melted butter, and dust lightly with flour. Place hazelnuts and 1 tablespoon confectioners' sugar in the bowl of a food processor fitted with a steel blade, and process until very fine. STEP 3 Combine hazelnut mixture, 1 cup plus 3 tablespoons confectioners' sugar, flour, and salt in a medium bowl. Add egg whites and vanilla, and whisk to combine. Add melted browned butter, and whisk until incorporated. With a tablespoon, fill molds evenly, about 3/4 of the way. Transfer to oven, and bake 14 to 18 minutes. Cool 2 minutes, and remove from pan. Cool completely on a rack, ridged side up. Dust cookies with confectioners' sugar.

review: The remake of a popular mod that Valve eventually bought.... like CS or TF2. But that doesn't matter. What matters is that it's a full game of that map that you loved to play on WC3. Better graphics, smoother gameplay, easier matchmaking and items that customize your hero appearance, potrait even spell animations(that actually require money but you can get it by playing). As for gameplay it's much smoother that WC3 and has gorgeos graphics because it runs on a modified source engine. Easier to play, even easier to pick up for new players. And you'll play with people of your skill level. Items are easier to build. Heroes are very well balanced. There is no hero that excells in every area. And no single match is the same. Every match different strategy different heroes and different enemies. Only downside that i really care about is the community. People does not know how to put their language preferences on their native language or the language that they actually speak. Every game you have that 1 or 2 guys that doesn't understand anything you say. Or a bunch of russians that'll rage over every single small mistake you make. SEA NA EUwest EUeast servers are all full of Russians. Russians are everywhere except for the Russian server. And while i'll admit that there are some good Russians who speak english and actually communicates with their team and not yell  BLYAT through their mic, but they're not that common. Overall good game, very well balanced. I give Dota 2 9/10. Recommended game but beware of the russians..........or pinoys.........or brazillians(or so i've heard).

review: Dota 2 is the coolest game I have ever played. It is very unique in it's own right. Sure, there are knock off's of Dota and Dota 2, but they don't even come close to this game. This is the single hardest game I've ever played and may ever play, and I do intend to keep on playing it. The learning curve is massive, the bots suck, and there is no good tutorial. Those are basically the only complaints I have about the game, but since I am not new to the game, they don't affect me. So many people play the game and get discouraged, but if you are reading this and are in that boat, stick with Dota 2. Once you reach the point of enlightenment, you will have so much fun. I recommend this game to anyone and everyone, and there is no excuse to not give it a fair chance.

game-hours: 1274.4
review: Hey you, yeah you! Don't have the brain capacity to control a massive army, build bases, and execute daring army battles even though this game's mechanics were taken from real-time-strategy games? And do you enjoy blaming teammates rather than doing something about it when you're losing? Do you enjoy picking characters, who only need right-clicks(carries) to function? Do you say "we no def" when you're losing even though the game is called DEFENSE OF THE ANCIENTS? Then if so you hypocritical basterd, this game is meant for you! Expect your first matches to be full of carries and practically no support plays at all! But who cares? You're having fun losing! Be careful though young warrior! Matches can be full of people complaining about your play or the items you buy! Don't worry they're just jealous of your feedi-- I mean killing streak! So what if they call a " play" or a "wrong item" on you, if you're getting killz, then it's all fine! They're just jelly that you found a secret new meta before they could! So what if you play a support hero and they complain when you last hit? Not your fault my brotha, they're just too slow to react! So what if you're a support hero and not buy wards? Those wards are expensive as shet! If they want all the farm, while you just stand there, and then expect you to buy wards, then they are  as ! How can you possibly buy wards when you don't have any gold?! Bunch of , amirite? You'll notice in your first games that people like to kill other people. Well that's normal, people do that in real life. But you must remember this golden rule: Always push. Kid, no matter how many times you pawn their noob arses you can't win if you can destroy the ancient. This game is not won by kills but by pushing. For example: There is an impending 5 on 5 brawl or "clash" as they call it. But as your teammates prepare for bloodshed you notice at the other side of the map a pack of allied mindless soldiers or "creeps" as they call it, slowly march towards an enemy tower. This is the perfect situation to push because the enemy "Heroes" are way too far to respond to their tower being pushed. So what do you do? Ditch your teammates and head for that tower. Wait until they have started fighting and then you push. With the enemy team busy slaying your outnumbered teammates, you're free to burn that tower down to the ground. Results? A bounty of gold, and a pushed tower! Your teammates can complain all they want about you leaving them, in fact they should be thanking you for giving them the tower bounty, ungrateful s. If somehow, you managed to get to their 3rd tower, you'll notice that behind it are two buildings. These two buildings spawn the mindless "creeps". Unless you destroy the 3rd tower, these buildings are invulnerable, meaning they can't be ed with. If you destroy the 3rd tower then they are stripped of their godlike armor and now are ok to  with. Pro tip: Destroy the melee barracks first. Why? Because destroying it somehow gives your melee creeps steroids. And since the melee creeps are the most produced creeps, giving them steroids is the most rewarding effect. And also, the building somehow has a regeneration effect, meaning it will heal itself! So if you're going to attack it, might as well kill it or you'll be forced to retreat and watch it "heal". Which leaves you as to how is it able to heal itself if it's just a building. How? Because f*ck logic that's why! And if you manage to destroy all of the enemy's barracks then the in-game announcer will shout: "Mega creeps!" Signifying that all of the allied creeps have steroids. At that point, you can pretty much let the creeps swarm the enemy. I mean why not? You fought your  out the whole match, and had to deal with the enemy's at, so why not let them have a slow and painful death? Sounds good doesn't it? And if you're lucky, you might witness an enemy hero get killed by being swarmed by your steroid creeps, fun ain't it? When picking a "hero" don't be that guy who picks first. And if you're notoriously unlucky, don't bother to random a hero. Yes it does give extra starting gold if you do, but you'll just end up giving it to the enemy as you feed. Let the others pick first. Take your time. This is the part of the game where you actually use the most of your mind with. Analyze, be considerate, and choose a hero who can both counter the enemy picks and complement your allied picks. Now that you've pick a hero it's time for the laning phase! If you're support then they will need wards, and wards need gold to possess, so what do you do? GO TO MID LANE. Why? So you can last hit without any teammate hogging all the farm. If you're carry then they will need you to get lots of exp and gold, so what do you do? GO TO MID LANE. If you're an offlaner then you need farm to get utility skills and items, so what do you do? GO TO MID LANE. If you're tank then they need you to get tanky items and lots of exp to get stronger, so what do you do? GO TO MID LANE. In fact, any hero you choose is a prime choice for mid lane. Remember, first come gets the lane. But anyways this game is quite addictive and may ruin your social life, if you even had one. Friends, family, love ones all seem insignificant when you're in a match. If you're still in school, study time may become dota time, and if you're working, well you know what's going to happen. Overall this game has achieved what all games should achieve: Making you play and enjoy this game. So yes I recommend this game. Good day to you sir
game-hours: 1552.2
review: DOTA 2 is a challenging game, and I have watched many of the friends I have tried to get to play ragequit, saying "It's too hard!". Even so, my personal experience has been a great one. The graphics are very fine, giving you a breath-taking, beautiful world to conduct battle in every time. The combot is fast-paced and well tuned, giving you 100+ characters with abilities that are well designed and feature very well done animation. One downside of DOTA matchmaking is that you often get teamed with people who don't speak your language, making team-coordination harder in pub matches, but matchmaking is very fast. A game best played with friends, DOTA is an awesome MOBA that will draw your attention continuosly after the first game. Graphics- 9/10 Gameplay- 9/10 Matchmaking 7/10 Overall- 8/10

game-hours: 1584.1
review: At first, I was completely unaware of how I should've played this game. But thanks to the community, I learned a few crucial steps to becoming a good player. I'd like to share the steps I've learned with the rest of the community. Step 1: During my first game, people told me that playing on an English version was a terrible idea, and they recommended me to go make it Russian. That increased how well I understood the game by tenfolds. Step 2: Always buy Mask of Madness and Divine Rapier. My team told me that these two items would make me win every game I played. Although it took me a bit of time to farm the Divine Rapier, the Mask of Madness made me attack super fast that I didn't need any other item. The Divine Rapier also made me hit very hard. If your team doesn't approve of this, they're just jealous that they didn't think of this build. Remember, the more rapiers, the better. Step 3: The last step is to pick these few heros if you're starting out: Meepo: His Ultimate ability is to make more meepos. More meepos=More fun. Chen: Even though he's labeled as a support, just go for the typical MoM Divine Rapier build on him. Works every time. Invoker: His Q, W and E give Strength, Agility and Intelligence respectively. His R is useless, so don't even both with it. All you need is the stats. And those are just a few of many helpful tips on how to become a good player in dota! I hope this review helped!

review: If you want cancer, you've come to the right place. Get ready to yell at everyone for being , Matched with people who don't speak English. Vow to quit the game, but only to give in 2 days later. Watch as you grades fall, along side with your MMR. Best game ever, would play / 10
game-hours: 283.9
review: Dota 2 (Defense of the Ancients 2) is one of the best MOBAs (Multiplayer Online Battle Arena - where the objective is to competitvely push 'lanes' and destroy enemy towers to eventually reach their base. First one to take down the enemy's Ancient (final, large building) wins), and one of the most popular (second only to League of Legends). It is very similar to LoL (although there is no 'surrender' feature in normal games - yet), and if you play LoL or most other MOBAs I can guarantee you'll have a good time in Dota 2, provided you can get over the difficulty. The difficulty in Dota 2 is much higher than other games of the same genre. League can be quite easy, but Dota is a complete other world, where if you don't do even the smallest split second thinking right, it can cost an entire teamfight and then lead to defeat. Don't let this scare you though, practising against bots will allow you to get ability and item combinations down pat. Although, if you've never played a MOBA before, it may take a while to learn. As well-known Dota 2 player Purge says, it will take about 2-3 months before you'd be considered 'ok' or 'decent'. Along side this difficulty in game is the players. Sometimes you'll get really nice players that joke around a bit, sometimes you'll get nice competitive players, sometimes you'll get people who joke around the entire game to annoy their team...but sometimes you'll get players who want nothing but perfection (I myself, at times, may be one of these people) and detriment their own team if the smallest thing isn't done correctly. There is a reason behind this, which is like I've meantioned before, even the slightest wrongdoing (tower diving for a kill A.K.A. suiciding - but this is quite a large example). The Heroes (not Champions) you get to play as are all given to you at the start, rather than 'buying' or unlocking them. Although this may seem like all the new players would get to play the best Heroes from the start, there isn't exactly a 'best Hero'. Heroes have many, many downsides and weaknesses, and if not played well can lead to some of those problems I've mentioned above. Once a Hero is learnt to play well though, it is possible to effectively dominate the enemy team when playing on pubs (casual servers). Beware when going into ranked matches though - most people in ranked will know how to play and what to do, as it requires a fair amount of playing to unlock 'ranked'. I myself unlocked it in ~120 games, which was for me 240 hours of playing the game. Overall, this is a great Free-To-Play game that is definitely worth getting. It's free after all, and it isn't a small game, unlike some F2P games that have next to no content or games that need to have most of the content bought to be able to use it and actually have fun in the game. It isn't Pay-To-Play in the slightest, as the only thing money can buy is extra looks for Heroes, Wards, HUDs, Couriers, and Loading Screens. There are about 10,000,000 regular users and counting. How about you join them? I'd give this game a 9.5/10, maybe even a 10 because of a Hero that is afraid of trees. Rizzrack/10, I love you Timbersaw

review: I HIGHLY reccomend this VERY popular game. It is a 5 v 5 battle game where you try to destroy the enemies base while waves of creatures from your team and the other team come. You have to do destroy buildings that attack you along the way to their base, the whole time leveling up your character with new skills and buying items from the shop, each one having a different abillity. With thousands, maybe millions of ways for you to make your character, and with over 100 different characters to choose from, no two games are ever the same. And that's the best part; you do everything you did all over again, while trying to improve your strategy. Unless you want to try a new character. The only downfall of this game is the learning curve. The tutorials that are in the game are okay at teaching you the basic mechanics of the game, there are tons of guides online that help you get a true understanding of the game. There are also reccomended builds for each character, helping you get a better understanding of each character. Once you have that, you are set to go. Hop in a normal game, and pick any of the limited characters selection, and enjoy! After all, while a game can be serious it's still a game, so have fun! I hope to see you sometime soon in a match!

game-hours: 454.8
review: Dota 2, or Defense of the Ancients 2 is a great free to play game, keeping real to the original mod of warcraft 3. Many people don't know the origins but this title began as a game-mod for warcraft 3. It was so intuitive and successful that it spawned an entire multiplayer online battle arena (or MOBA) genre. Basically, it is a game created, maintained, funded, promoted and played solely by gamers. To know that this formula has lead it into a limelight of success is a warm feeling to anyone involved. The support this game has received has been phenomenal, though the concept is fairly simple. Dota 2 is a professional game experience, much like a game of baseball or football. The stage is set in an online computer regulated fantasy battlefield arena which makes the action more interesting and the gameplay more fair. Players join together in groups of five to take on opponents casually with public matchmaking or by forming professional competitive teams. Each player picks from a rooster of 100+ heroes each with unique abilities and statistics. Players then battle on a field of war, where the two npc armies release waves of troops to engage each other. This is where the game refines itself, though the stage does not change each battle is unique and requires great concentration and mastery to defeat your enemy. To become successful does require a certain level of prowess, so it is recommended new players begin by trying out a couple hundred public matchmaking games. You might think I'm joking, but that is just the start of the journey. As you become more successful your rankings will increase, making you more attractive for recruiters. Unless you already have a team formed and have had previous competitive experience, you might not be immediately ready for high level gameplay. Do not be discouraged, however! The game is great about teaming you up with players of your own skill level. Because the game is team based by nature, it is natural to meet new friends online to play with. It is important to be courteous and not overly rude, because your reputation spreads. If you are friendly and assist your team-mates, they may grant you after battle accolades or want to become your friend. If you are rude and flaming, your team-mates will work against you or sometimes quit altogether. In your early stages it is important to be open and respectful. If you're not sure what to do don't be afraid to ask. The game features an awesome built in microphone system, so if you own the hardware talking to your opponents is as easy as a click. As you complete more battles you earn more rewards, experience, accolades and friends. Rewards include special items and equipment for your heroes. Special effects and modifications to the user interface and stage design. Custom load screens, custom courier graphics, custom animations and plenty of exclusives which can be bought and sold on the steam market! Probably the only downfall here is the high intensity and length these games operate on. It is not unusual for a good game to take hours to complete. Sometimes it can be really heart pounding when you have a close game and both teams are equally matched. The minions flood the screen and team battles clash on, eventually leading a single team to victory. Though the game lacks a lot of what a traditional game is expected to have it is still a full experience. Dota 2 has come a long way and its ambition as a flagship for competitive gamers is something to respect. Its an awesome experience to be part of. Having the full support of steam and by having content designed by the player base, we see a role for anyone who is not successful with the sometimes overly competitive aspect. Much of the reason the original defense of the ancients was successful was because the community had such a large input into the designs of the game. Often the developers recruited within the games player base or other well known modders to help design their masterpiece. Today's Dota 2 sees even larger support, having systems in place to collect almost all 3d model submissions. When new heroes are designed players are both testers and developers of expansion content. This experience makes you feel in touch with the game. Ultimately however, this game is for the players. Battles are tough and the more experienced you become the more difficult opponents you will become matched with. There comes a point where being matched against a fully microphoned team is going to become common. Because I have played this game for so long and know a lot about it, I am not immediately put off by this. However, be warned prolonged exposure to Dota 2 is definitely not a casual experience. Though I always recommend one conduct themselves in the best manor for an optimum experience, you will encounter those who do not agree with these principles. Dota 2 has become a source of income for some, so it is important to those individuals to never lose. If you dont really care if you win or lose and are just looking for a quick way to pass the time, this game can provide you and a group of friend tons of fun. If you are looking to follow the road of success, prepare for a difficult journey. I definitely recommend Dota 2 for all gamers that would call themselves competitive. It is simple, sleek and sexy. Highly appealing and easy to pick up. Best of all, free and highly compatible and supported. Link directly up to your steam account and find out which of your friends play already. You might be surprised! Spending money in this game almost always results in only ascetic changes. This game is definitely not a pay to win game! In fact, one might even generate your own steam dollars by selling the items won from this game! Download it today!

game-hours: 2207.9

game-hours: 1241.2
review: I started playing dota long ago and my life became progressively worse. I gained weight rapidly, I began isolating myself from social interactions and the little interactions I did participate in - I was very rude and racist towards anyone who even looked at me. Then I quit because reasons. Then my life started improving. I lost most of the weight I gained, I was dating, I got a nice job and I excelled in all my university classes. Then Dota2 came out. I was given a beta key and it sat in my steam inventory for many months taunting me. It's red glow symbolizing some deep-seated temptation that made me think of nefarious djinns of stories long forgotten. So inviting and so beautiful. But I knew it's secrets and I knew what those secrets did to me. But sadly even the strongest and tallest mountain will eventually fall and crumble to the gentle peppering of rain. After the five-hundreth (im lying, it was like 3 probs) demand that I start playing, my willpower gave in and fell into the blackness once again. I could feel some etheral blackness grasp its fingers around my still-recovering mind. As the game finished installed and I pressed that 'Play Now' button, I realized that I just jumped off the bridge that I was so very carefully constructing ever since quitting the first DOTA. Everything came rushing back to me. One game became ten and ten games became one-thousand. My girlfriend when I began again has left me already and I feel nothing but pity for her because she only wants me to leave the one I trulty love. review: INTRODUCTION Dota 2 is a game where it contradicts life and death. Dota was based on World Of Warcraft as Dota 2 is now based on itself.With new looks compared to Dota and a brand new map with much more and now even better a free to play game! POSITIVE: 1.Its graphics are amazing compared to Dota and LOL 2.It has a wonderfull variety of heroes which could be built in unlimited possibilities 3.You can either rage or laugh at the noobs who try to play Dota 2 while feeding. 4.Plenty of core items for heroes and lots of active items like Radiance and Abyssal Blade NEGATIVE: 1.The tutorial needs improvement because when i played the tutorial,it felt just like playing World Of Warcraft. 2.Need lots of experience with these games because lots of high ranked players raged at you for feeding the enemy team. 3.League Of Legends (LOL) copied this game and many other players from LOL say that Dota 2 copied them when its actually LOL who copied Dota 2 CONCLUSION This game is really addictive where funny and wtf moments meets your ways.Overall Dota2 deserves around of applause as LOL should  off because they suck. BIOGRAPHY My life of Dota 2 started as a young boy at the age of 11 who was looking through piles of games when i found something interesting.I downloaded the game and started playiing it.Years past as i played hours and hours as days past by.When i was 23,i got myfirst car and a girlfriend.When my girlfriend was wondering why i never asked her on a date, i just asked that i was busy.But 1 day i got careless and didnt hear the door open as my girlfriend came in and asked what are you doing.I thought she would break up with me but she only said what game is it?I replied with that this game was called Dota 2.When she got home she immediatly downloaded Dota 2 and started playing with me.We had so much fun until at the age of 34,where we got married and had 2 children,1 boy and 1 girl and still playing Dota2.Well now you see how much fun Dota 2 is.I wont force you to play it but i will say this,try Dota2 rather then other games because this game will give you eternal happiness. THE END

review: From an avid League player, it's a bit hard to get into and understand at first. But once you get your main role going and start to learn the hero's you can play it can get pretty fun. Until you meet Viper... /rage about one of his passives is a slow every auto attack Compared to League it has a lot less skill shots and more lock on's. However there is still a lot of skill to be had at this game, not runes or masteries, denying, and losing some gold upon death. Just make sure you don't spam your spells. Your mana pool is very low and mana regen is little to nothing early game. A very different game with not a lot to compare to, but they're both equally fun in their own way.

review: Looking to cut yourself off from the real world? Life getting too boring for you? Or are you just simply finding for a way to throw your dull life away? Look no further, this game is the game for you. This game promises you hours of fun on end. You fight in a team to claim victory over the enemy team's Ancient, hence the title "Defence of the Ancients". Some heroes are easily grasped, making it easy for beginners to learn the basics. Once you start getting the hang of things and master the basics, there are a hundred other heroes to learn and master. Personally, this game has ruined my life. With about 400 hours of gameplay, my grades have dropped, I have no time to hang out with friends anymore, my family hates me because I'm always in my room, you name it, I'm probably there right now. But I've never been happier in my life. Girlfriend? Sorry, I don't know what that is.

game-hours: 1521.8
review: If you're a gamer, you would probably have heard of the term MOBA which stands for Multiplayer Online Battle Arena and one of the games leading the way in that genre is DotA since that's where it basically all began. DotA 2 is a direct sequel to the original bringing us updated graphics and easier controls making the already difficult game a bit more accessible to newer people for the genre. This game is very much like a sport in which it requires lots of strategies and team-coordination in order to win. However, much like a sport, it requires time and patience to hone your skills in order to be good at it so if you're willing to put the effort into it, DotA 2 can be an extremely enjoyable and satisfying experience for you. Just be wary that there are a considerable number of players in the community who can be considered 'toxic' and can be very unfriendly. If you can somehow try to avoid them as much as possible (e.g. only playing with friends you know), you're going to have a blast with this game. Good luck and Have fun :)

game-hours: 952.9
review: The game is so addicting that I eventually had to force myself to uninstall it for awhile so I can do other things in life. Take that as you will. If you never played Dota before (or any moba) and are interested in trying it out, please refer to noob guides online (Purge...or just google "Dota 2 noob guide"). The in-game Dota tutorial is not complete (but you should do it because, hey, it's better than nothing). Be prepared to endure abuse in pubs once you start actually playing. Don't worry, you'll grow immune to it over time. And it is worth it. The game is so satisfying once you've grasped the fundamentals and hereos. The more you play, you began to realize just how deep this game is. Over a hundered hours into the game and I was still learning. Both the depth and variation in gameplay (due to hero selection at the start of each match...and there are 108 of them at the time of this writing) contribute to the addictive nature of Dota. Recommended for those into mobas and strategy games. Not recommended for casual gamers. After playing this, I've discovered that lifestealer has two meanings. It's a hero in the game and it's Dota 2 itself. You have been warned.

review: Dota 2: This game is a creative, interesting and complex Multiplayer Online Battle Arena, but suffers in some areas as well (more on that later). My recommendation is to give it a try to see if you like it, because it's completely free to play. Positives: + The most important of all, this game is quite fun. + The intricacy of Dota 2 is a standout feature. There's a huge number of heroes to select, with strength, agility and intelligence characters. Each have different types of abilites for unique situations. This gives Dota 2 massive variety. Every hero has a role to play in the game, whether you're supporting teammates with buffs and heals or disabling enemies by slowing or stunning them. Other heroes do more damage per second, so they can carry the team. There's a lot of flexibility here so each game can differ. The battles can become hectic and tactical, with enemies trying to ambush others from fogged areas of the map. There is definitely an art to it and skill involved. + Each hero can purchase items to boost their attack speed, armour, health regeneration, damage, movement speed and other attributes. These additional stats aid you in fighting your foes and escaping swiftly, providing another layer of decision making to the game. + Free to play, which is always welcome. Won't cost you any money and you can keep playing forever if you enjoy it. + Dota 2 has a massive community behind it, so there's always a game available to join. Negatives: - The map layout can become repetitive and boring on occasions. The same map is played every single game, no exceptions, which can get tiresome and tedious. There's 3 lanes and you level your hero by attacking enemy units. You do this over and over, for each match, assigning skill points to your abilities. The early gameplay consists of carefully running back and forth within attack range of enemy heroes, trying to 'last hit' creeps for gold. - Some members of the Dota 2 community are abusive or just plain immature. While this can easily be ignored, it doesn't create a welcoming atmosphere in the game. Now and again you'll get someone who whines about how pro they are and puts the team down, despite playing badly themselves. - The graphics are superior to any other MOBA game, but they are still very cartoonish and ugly. Highly unappealing. Overall Score: 8/10 A solid, fun game that involves true teamwork. It has a few downfalls, but will still entertain you.

game-hours: 568.6
review: Dota 2 is a learning game. It's a game about how good you are "relatively". Everyone is terrible at Dota, (you can't help it) all that matter is how good you are, relative to how good your enemy is. I like Dota because it keeps me saying stuff like "Wait, that can happen?" and "Oh, that's how that works." on a daily baisis. There's always more to learn. The complexity of this game is so deep that you can't possibly expect to know all there is to know. You will never come across the same scenario twice, maybe the same team oor enemy team, but never the same items, gold skill levels, couldowns, mana and health levels etc. The point is, Dota 2 is a game that you play to have fun and just because you're not as good as you'd like to be doesn't mean you're not good at Dota. ~Thank you "Three Lane Highway" for insight into what kind of a game Dota 2 really is.~

game-hours: 412.6
review: READ ME !! It doesnt matter how good you are at Dota 2 now. At some point you were a noob. Weve all been there. Some get out quicker, others stay longer, and some others are still there. At some point, youll encounter them as opponents or as teammates. However, not all noobs are new to the game. Some just play like they are. Check out the different kinds of noobs youll encounter in Dota 2. 1. The know-it-all noob Hes new to the game, but for some reason, he acts and talks like he knows everything, though he has nothing to show for it. Sometimes, hes the most learned guy in his circle of noob friends and has brought this attitude over when interacting with you. Other times, hes just trying to bluff to look like hes less of a noob. If youre this guy, stop bluffing. We know you know nothing. That Desolator sitting beside the Helm of the Dominator on your Drow Ranger says it all. Signature quote: I know!! 2. The veteran noob Hes been playing this game for so long, youre not sure how he doesnt know the basics yet. On a scale of one to ten, his level of map awareness is blind and his ability to read a game is abysmal. Hell pick a Nightstalker that farms the jungle during night time because hes faster. After a hundred games with Sven, he still forgets to activate Warcry. He will attempt to force team fights when the rest of you are trying to push or will decide to push a lane when a team fight is about to break. (This things that  off carry players in Dota 2) What makes this worse is if hes the talkative type. He makes weird calls based on experience, which often dont make sense. And he also has an excuse for every single mistake he makes: The monitor is too bright, my eyesight is affected., This isnt the monitor resolution Im used to., The airconditioning is too cold, my fingers are getting numb., I had no mana (when he did)., It was on cooldown (when it wasnt). Signature quote: I was able to do it last time. When I wasnt with you. 3. The exotic noob Of course, trying out different things is okay and can actually help you discover new things. The exotic noob, however, tries to be different way before he tries what is considered normal. If the norm is to farm a Battlefury on Anti-Mage, hes going to build something else. Like Force Staff! So he can chase faster with twice the distance. Theyre never going to expect that! The main goal here is to be different. Making sense comes second. Or third. Signature quote: I have my reasons. Youll see. 4. The panic noob The name says it all. The panic noob often only shows his true colors during teamfights. Hes okay during the laning phase, but once he gets ganked or when a team fight breaks out, he becomes so overwhelmed and excited that he ends up doing nothing right or everything wrong. Dont be harsh to this noob. Thatll just make him panic more. Signature quote: Wheres the cursor!? Wait, where am I!? 5. The spectator noob Like the panic noob, this kind of noob only appears during team fights and skirmishes regardless of whether hes part of them or not. When a fight breaks out, he stops what hes doing and checks out whats going on. He watches the teamfight and forgets to control his hero, which is now either standing in the middle of nowhere or dropping really low, really fast (if not dead yet). Signature quote: Oh, sh*t, my hero! 6. The noob from another game This guy takes note of how many different aspects of Dota 2 are unlike League of Legends (LoL) or Heroes of Newerth (HoN). He can even note how Starcraft II is so much better than this genre. The most famous variant of this noob is the one that complains a lot about this game not being his preferred game and expects you to take that as a good reason for mouthing off or calling your mother names. However, I must point out that theres a second variant of this noob; the one that comes in peace, is curious, and has stepped out of his comfort zone so he can see for himself what was up. Be nice to this guy. He might refer to heroes as champions, but he means no harm. Signature quote: Its so different from (insert game name here) because there, we (insert whatever it is they do in another game) ( Weekend time waster: this is what happens when a League of Legends player tries Dota 2) 7. The legit noob The actual novice. He can not only be new to Dota 2, but also to MOBA gaming. And if youre unlucky, he just might be new to gaming, too. GLHF! Signature quote: (A ton of questions or nothing at all) So did any of the items on the list remind you of a friend or some random person you met in pub matchmaking? Or did it perhaps remind you of your former (or dare I say current) self? If it did, dont worry. We wont judge you because we were all once noobs, too. OK this is a LOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOONG post BUT i want you to close your eyes , then imagine a BIG MULTI COLORED POTATO............. (cuz we cannot put a picture in the review section =3 hava a good day =)

review: Over 300 hours of yelling in my mic a mix of Russian, Spanish and English. -------Actual Review------- (Work in progress) Background of game: DOTA originated as a warcraft 3 mod, which can still be played. Then Valve took this game, re-masterd it, and made it one of the biggest MOBAs (But still only has a fraction of LOL's player base). The Good: -Valve's got lots of money, and so does the player base. This causes some darn large prize-pools, which are also contributed to by the players. The Bad: -Addictive as hell. -About 1/10 players speak a different language and don't care to learn english. Examples include: Russian, Spanish, and Portuguese. Other Problems: -Warcaft DOTA had a lot of heroes which were ported into DOTA 2, causing a lot of copyright problems between Blizzard and Valve. Gameplay: First games should be with bots, and maybe after 10 games you should start playing with people. If you don't know what to buy, valve gives you suggestions based on your hero in the buy-menu. If looking for a guide, you can find one in the top right.

game-hours: 500.6
review: Dota 2 is a multiplayer online battle arena game in a three-dimensional environment, presented from an oblique high-angle perspective. The player commands one of 109 controllable character "Heroes." Each Hero begins the match at level one and becomes more powerful by accumulating experience points through combat, thereby leveling up to the maximum level of twenty-five. With every level gained the player either selects a new ability for their Hero to learn or enhance their general statistics. Each Hero's method of combat is influenced by its primary property: Strength, Agility, or Intelligence. Dota 2 features items, which the player stores in an inventory. These items are acquired predominantly through purchase with gold, the in-game currency. Items vary in function: some enhance the statistics of a Hero, while others grant additional abilities. The player automatically receives small increments of gold continuously, though they can obtain more by destroying enemies. Killing non-player characters grants gold only to the player who lands the final blow, whereas killing enemy Heroes grants gold to the player's nearby allies as well. Destroying Towers or killing Roshan gives gold to all players on the team. "Denying" is a feature of the game where players inhibit the enemy's ability to accumulate gold and experience by killing an allied unit or destroying an allied structure before the enemy can do so. Each match of Dota 2 takes place on a functionally symmetrical map that features the strongholds of two warring factions, the Radiant and the Dire. The Radiant is based at the southwest corner of the map, while the Dire is based at the northeast corner; the two sides are divided by a river that runs perpendicular to the central lane. These factions are defended by up to five players. In each stronghold is a critical structure called the "Ancient", a fountain that provide health and lesser structures. These bases are connected by three paths, referred to as "lanes"two run alongside the edges of the map, while one runs directly between the two bases. The lanes are guarded by defensive Towers, as well as autonomous characters called "creeps", which periodically spawn in groups and travel along the lanes, attacking enemies they encounter. Featured across the map are hostile characters referred to as "neutrals", which are not aligned to either faction and are primarily located in the forests. Located in a tarn on the northeast side of the river is a "boss" called "Roshan", who typically requires multiple team members to kill and drops powerful items. Dota 2 features seasonal events, which provide players with the option of playing the game with special game modes that alter the aesthetics and objectives. With the seasonal event game modes, the central focus of the game shifts away from the standard battle composition, in order to focus on new objectives central to the seasonal events. So far, there have been three seasonal events: the Halloween-themed Diretide event, the Christmas-themed Frostivus event, and the New Bloom Festival, which celebrates the coming of spring.

review: FYI: Dota stands for Defense of the Ancients Hello Ladies and Germs! Today you are looking at Dota 2 Review! Dota used to be a gamemode in Warcraft 3! It was so Popular it went on steam! If you haven't played Dota 2 or Warcraft 3 Dota then this review will help you out! First of all Dota 2 IS NOT A FIRST PERSON SHOOTER GAME. It is a strategy game so if you do not like strategy games or you just suck at it then don't play it plz. The Goal of the game is theres 3 Towers on each 3 Sides. Fight your way and Destory the Radiant's/Dire's Ancient and you will win the game! It's a 5V5 Game so you need to rely on your team too. There are 3 types of heroes: Strength, Agility, and Intelligence. Strength are really tanky which means they have more health and less mana, they are also mostly nukers, pusher, etc. Agilitys depends on items so most of them are carrys which means they farm. Intelligence have lots of mana and most of them are supports because most of them can trap, heal, etc. But most intelligence heroes are squishy (means they can die easily, example: Crystal Maiden (idk if i spelled it right lol)).

review: Dota 2... You can love it, hate it, or both at the same time. Dota 2 is the re-boot of the original Dota game made in 2005 and is owned by the company Valve. Dota 2 is a MMOBA (or Massive Multilayer Online Battle Arena) and the objective of the game is to be able to destroy the enemy's ancient. You do this by picking from the 112 unique heroes that are available for you for free for ever. The game itself is similar to its predecessor as well as other MMOBA's but adds new mechanics as well as customization items for most of the heroes. The game play is smooth and well refined, all the heroes have there own unique play style, and it fits well with the game. Dota 2 although it may not have mind blowing effects still manages to look astonishing as well as not stressing your computer too hard, and if you don't like the way something looks you can change it. Valve introduces a cosmetic system that adds no benefits or hindrances to the game but it allows you to make the game the way you want, whether you like cruel dire tide or crystallized manna there are cosmetics and other customization items for everyone. The game also has a ranked system for more serious players who want to make it to a team. Replayability is a huge part of a game and Dota 2 has it there are multiple game modes ranging from a random hero to drafting a whole team with this system it will take a while to be able to get board of Dota 2. For a ranking all around i would have to give it a 9.5/10 due to some minor flaws. This is shown in ranked, they need a way to measure the single person and not just the team as a whole this can lead to being trapped in low brackets.

game-hours: 784.3
review: A standard match of Dota 2 features the strongholds of two opposing factions, the Radiant and the Dire, containing critical structures called "Ancients", which are surrounded by a number of lesser buildings. The bases of these two factions are connected by three main paths, referred to as "lanes", which are guarded by defensive towers, as well as autonomous units called "creeps", which periodically spawn in groups and traverse the lanes, attacking enemy units or structures they encounter. The Dota 2 map is functionally symmetrical, despite having a number of critical differences conferring a variety of advantages and disadvantages to each side. The Radiant is based at the southwest corner of the map, while the Dire is based at the northeast corner; the two sides are divided by a river that runs perpendicular to the central lane. The two teams, typically composed of five players each, are pitted against one another to compete as the defenders for their respective Ancients.[6] Featured across the map are hostile units referred to as "neutrals", which are not aligned to either faction and are primarily located in the forests. Located on the northeast side of the river is a "boss" called "Roshan", who typically requires multiple team members to kill and drops strategically powerful items.

review: With dota i've spent almost half of my life. When i was 14 i started with warcraft 3, it was amazing :) Then few years later, friends dragged me to dota. Since that time i never really stoped playing. Few years ago Valve announced its own dota game in cooperation with icefrog. A lot of my mates were sceptical (because of previous attempts for "new dota" - LoL and HoN - were ultimate failure to them). I wasn't, because of icefrog. Since the very beginning i believed in icefrog and in valve and just few weeks after first international i got my own betakey and started to play it. From the very beggining i was so excited about this. Icefrog kept EVERYTHING same, just upgraded things that needed upgrade (graphics, some key mechanics which were limited by warcraft). Ive spent over 10 000 hours in dota2 (dont get confused by hours count on this account ive got a lot of "smurfs") and countless hours in dota overall. Ive met hundreds of amazing people on offline tournaments just because of dota. Countless of amazing people online. For almost decade this game was part of my life and i gotta say THANK YOU ICEFROG AND VALVE AND EVERYONE INVOLVED IN THIS. Dota 4ever <3

game-hours: 517.7
review: One of the best multiplayer online battle arena game; its gameplay focuses on combat in a three-dimensional environment, presented from an oblique high-angle perspective. What I liked on this game is that this is played in discrete matches involving two five-player teams, each of which occupies a stronghold at a corner of the map. Each stronghold contains a building called the "Ancient", which the opposite team must destroy to win the match. Each player controls a "Hero" character and focuses on leveling up, collecting gold, acquiring items and fighting against the other team to achieve victory.

His most cherished weapon was his P2000 Franklin, which he named "Lord Farquad's Holy Pistola". But one day he realized, "Is a 360 YY Noscope Headshot what I really want?" He talked with his mate, a good ol' pal from Scotland about his recent Quickscope boredom and he said this, "I have come to the same #struggles m8, but in my time of darkness, Lord Gaben showed me to the light." "But how?" I asked, perplexed with this impossible thing. The Scotsman took him down to the Steam Store, and showed him a game hidden in a corner. He told me, "Only the strongest and wisest may find there way to this game..." As he waved his hand twoards the strange red insignia. "Oh what ever is it?" I asked him, eyes wide with perplexion, "This is the game League despises, and one of the hardest MOBAS in the world, but Lord Gaben hath bequeathed upon us to conquer it." He told me. This game was Dota 2. 15/10 better than league

review: DOTA 2 is for certain the best MOBA game on the market. Completely free to play, with all heroes unlocked from the start. Plenty of patches have changed how characters work, added different events, and added more heroes to play with; making it a great package for the price of... well nothing! If you are new to MOBAs; DOTA 2 may be a hard game to get into due to the high learning curve. Do not have that discourage you however, as plenty of hours are waiting to be taken by this fantastic game.

game-hours: 1120.3
review: 10/10
game-hours: 2129.0
review: Addictive Exhilarating Frustrating If you are new to dota or new to moba in general. Prepare for a huge learning curve or give up now than waste time and give up in the middle. Not much to talk regarding the Game. Its a very nice Overhaul of Dota 1. It is Free to play. This game is the very definition of Free to play or what Free to play games should be like The other So called Free to play games out there are nothing more than freemium games where you pay to dominate or pay to experience new heroes. No offense. Patches are there every few months which redefines the game creating new Metas This game is mostly dependent on the people you play with. It can rated 10/10 or 6/10 mostly dependent on your teammates. Atleast that is my perspective. The perspective is entirely dependent on the fact that you are aware of its gameplay mechanics and you play like 50% of the people out there. Examples would be Supports not Supporting (No Wards/Courier/Dewarding but taking last hits/Kill Stealing). Kill Steal is relatively easy for support as they are mostly start - mid gamers. Mostly skill dependent but the their skill dmg is pretty good for start game. Examples of carries not carrying (Got no idea how to LH/ Leave a kill and sometimes they will let them escape. Happens rarely./NCING WHEN YOU HAVE A FREE LANE. I really got no idea why some people do this its just 10mins you are frigging heavy and you are ncing when there is a frigging free lane/Roaming in ganks when you can get free farm. I dont mind them roaming in ganks if we successfully pull of the gank but most of the ganks end up with neither side initiating and it will be like a standstill which wastes the farm of a heavy carry and also the exp/ this is applicable for semi they sometimes spend most of their time farming when they could do some good in ganks and sometimes for heavy where they farm full game and go rosh and back to farm.) Community - 2.5/10 No map awareness No CHAT Awareness Crude/Harsh/Egoistic/ I got no idea where they come from If you are in a 3k MMR rating like me dont expect good teammates. More than half of them are trash like players. The remaining % would be pretty decent and encouraging players if you find any like that. I have been ingame with a couple of decent and gameplay encouraging gamers. Too much Cussing. If you play dota please dont do this. It not only affects your game but also your teammate or teammates if they are in a party and it will be a internal outbreak. Spend more time chatting less time focusing on the game I recommend you get a couple of your friends 2-3 is good so that you can even out the picks and enjoy the game. Right now my main issue is with the community Win or loss does not matter much as long as you enjoy the game. Unless your opposition is a bunch of people who trashtalk then Winning matters VERY MUCH. -8.5/10 Warning May or may not ruin your life. The choice lies with you. You may experience a variety of uncontrollable emotions.

review: Brilliant game, made even more amazing with your friends' co-operation However, there is one bad side. Although this game is shockingly awsome, there is a bad point to it. There are some items that are incredibly rare and un-attainable unless you are willing to pay a good 30/50 for them. For example the Treasure of the Emerald Dragon that came out recently was only out for an hour and the items within it are amazing but are beyond comprehension and you'd have to sell an unusual of TF2 in order to obtain it. It's a fun game in itself, however I'm just a bit peeved that the developers would make it so impossible for fans to gain the cooler items they love and how some treasures are hidden from the public eye. Download the game, love it for what it is and sell your soul to it; then realise you can't obtain the beautiful items you would like :)

Why is hard? Because its not only about learn the game mechanics, its about to make the right decision at the right moment, that's probably the most hard part. By the way enemies make mistakes too, so the team that wins is the one that is better at handling situations. review: It's a purgatory simulator based on the existential novel No Exit, in which you are trapped in a game with 9 other people who hate you. You spend your time killing the same enemies, who spawn every 30 seconds for all eternity, until you have amassed an arbitrary amount of gold/items with which you kill the other team. The worst 2 players in the game are blamed for every mistake made and ridiculed without mercy, while the player with the highest kill/death ratio (often times not the best player) calls you a  for a 60 minute duration. It's a really nice game and I highly recommend it.

game-hours: 277.5
review: Originally a Warcraft 3 mod, this highly influential arena style game has inspired many spin offs including the acclaimed League of Legends. Unlike League of Legends however, you can control all 112 heroes when you buy the game, and there is no "pay to win" features at all; all bonus items are purely cosmetic and for fun. The community can even create content that can be acquired in game! The only shortcoming to DotA is that it will be a little more difficult to pick up compared to League of Legends. Given the chance however, DotA2 will prove to be a much more balanced and skill-oriented experience, with meaningful item and ability selection and a more dynamic gold farming game which both provide superior short and long term strategic gameplay. Try the one that started it all, you won't be disappointed!
game-hours: 622.5

game-hours: 2160.2
review: Trial by fire. Straight up. You're going to learn exceptions to the rule by being killed by them, and it's going to happen a lot. Dota is the most brutal learning curve of any game I've ever played. Sometimes in a well-done fashion, sometimes not. There are few games where I can honestly say that at 300 hours you have barely any true idea what you're doing. Amazingly complex game! Tons of fun, especially with friends. Not a casually oriented game at all, but enormously entertaining to play and watch. No grind, no microtransactions that affect gameplay in any way. No outside advantages, no premade skills. Everything happens in game and you need to be quick on your feet. Try it out! Just be warned that properly trying it out will take hundreds of hours. Relax, you're doing fine.

game-hours: 446.2
review: ..Rampage!! :D
game-hours: 3776.9
review: I've played dota 2 since the 3rd quarter of 2012. So I've had it for 2 1/4 years. Thats 19710 hours. Now lets assume you're supposed to have 8 hours of sleep every day, so i've been awake supposedly for 13140 hours of that time? Now further lets assume you go to full time education (like i did) and spend approximately 4 hours a day in school/university (on average). That leaves you with 9855 hours. So I've had 9855 hours of spare time in the last 2 and a bit years to study, get fit, get a girlfriend, find a job and get successful and this time also includes eating time and laying around doing nothing/watching tv time. I've spent 1/3 of my time playing Dota 2? Is it an amazing game? Absolutely. If I could go back and decide whether to start playing it? Hell no. About 3k hours in dota 2, and probably about 1.5k hours in DotA. If i had done anything productive during that 4.5k hours I would be pretty rich or happy with my self by now. But instead i'm fat and have no job and got horrible grades in uni so far. Now that was the disclaimer. Time to rate the game out of 10 for graphics, gameplay, storyline, replayability and then an overall score. Moba's are not usually played for graphics so much. The main focus of the game is on the actual gameplay, but in comparison to the other big "moba" games, Dota 2 has quite good graphics. If you're looking for a visually amazing game you can spend time on, Dota 2 might not be the best choice, because its not really made for the graphics. If you want a moba with good graphics look at smite, dawngate or heroes of the storm (none of which i've played but their screenshots look like they have slightly better graphics than dota 2). Also, dota 2 has a few female characters but if your in it for the revealing type images of characters go play league of legends because you're probably gonna never load into a game without seeing bewbs. Graphics Score: 7/10 Gameplay. Dota 2 has amazing gameplay. After playing so many times i still feel like theres ever so little more i need to know because gameplay is changed slightly (or sometimes vastly) by patches. The patches are seeming to come more regularly (now 2 months in a row with 1 patch per month). The skills a dota 2 player needs to learn to be really great can take years and years to get good at. Reaction time isn't the only important thing but strategy and calculations are important. In comparison to LoL which is the only other moba i have played, Dota 2 has significantly more strategy involved in pub games. I play LoL game where people barely speak or plan out whats going on. In dota 2 there are so many tense occasions where you and your team have to roam the map and farm in a group and avoid smoke ganks. Other gameplay factors which enhance skill required is the timer system of jungle spawns (stacking, pulling), creep blocking, denying allied creeps (and heroes in some cases!) and the last most important thing is that whereas in LoL where a majority of heroes can solo kill others, you need to organise ganks very well with allies to get kills. Dota 2 takes a while to learn but the satisfaction is ever-present once you've gotten to a certain point. Gamplay Score: 10/10 Storyline. The lore in DotA was nice to learn about. The dota 2 lore is pretty bad and not really linked to the original game. Valve doesn't release any storyline related videos for dota 2 really. The advantage of this is that since the game has source film maker with it (i havent used sfm yet), a lot of talented people have created SFM videos on youtube which are really enjoyable to watch. Having said that if you want a game for its story I would not recommend dota 2 for that. Compared to games like smite and lol the character backgrounds aren't really important and many (including myself can't be bothered reading). The only story in the game is kind of a tutorial form which is nice for new players. Storyline Score: 4/10. Replayability. This is self explanatory. I have spent 4.5k hour around for this game and DotA. It is probably one of the most replayable games ever made. You will almost never have 2 games with the exact same heroes and team (unless maybe in captains mode where you can ban and pick) and games can last between 10 mins and 1 and a half hours (some are faster or longer but this is the general sweet spot with the average (non-abandoned) game lasting about 40ish mins). Replayability Score: 10/10 Overall. Dota 2 lacks a little bit in the story area but this game was not meant for that. This game was made for literally endless fun and playing. This overall score will not be an average of the other scores but more of the total enjoyability of the game i've been hooked on for the last 7 years. Overall Score 9.5/10 (not 10/10 because that would imply that its the most perfect game ever created, which i still think it could be a little bit better)

review: Approaching 2100 hours played...wow. While I do completely agree with the reviews that talk about how bad the community is, I have to say my experience of Dota on the whole has been very enjoyable. The mute option is great, I insta-mute anyone talking crap. Admittedly Dota has an incredibly high learning curve, and you will often find high level players playing on "noob" accounts so even the early matches for new players can be brutal. If you can push through the first couple of hundred hours of games ;) and ignore the torrent of expletives thrown your way when you let the team down!; you will find Dota 2 to be a: competitive, intense, challenging, and completely engaging experience.
