game-hours: 1031.8
review: Dota 2 is one of the most fantastic strategy game i've ever played. There are some few things i'd like to review about some great features that Dota 1 hasnt: 1) Customize In-Game Effects. Valve really did a great job by adding some feature like customize hero with different types of armor. You can also customize courier, announcer, mega-kill voice, and loading screen. Good news is those items can be earned from drops after game that have a different drop chance depend on its rarity, the higher rarity = the better looks of items. so more play = more items ! :) 2) Level-system. Just like every online game does, you can't refuse a level-system. In Dota 2, The higher the level means the higher rarity of items you can get. You can earn a higher level by gaining battle points from every game you play 3) Ranked Match Feature. Valve also added ranked match feature. I think this is the very reason why i move to Dota 2 from Dota 1. After you reach level 13, you'll be able to play ranked match. There are two kinds of ranked match, first solo ranked match, second party ranked match. Solo ranked match works if you play alone (without party), party ranked match works if you play with your party that consist of 2,3 or 5 people. More rating you get means more skilled-person you can play with. 4) Watch Live Game and In-Game Replay Download. In Dota 1, you have to be an observer to watch a game. In Dota 2, Valve makes it easier by adding "Watch" tab in game. From this feature, you can spectate every single game from Steam server, not to mention you can also watch a professional match that is available everyday. If you think the game you watched is interesting, you are able to download the replay everytime and learn from it. I'm sorry for bad english, I hope this review's helpful. Regards, Heisenberg.

game-hours: 452.2
review: Dota 2 is one of the best games out there, provided you're not too obsessed with overrated first person shooters like Call of Duty. It might be a little bit complicated at first but when you figure out how it works you will never want to stop playing this game. In Dota 2 there are plenty of heros to play, as well as types of heros so that you will never be at a loss trying to find someone to suit you. There are a few things to be pointed out though, teamwork is essential to accomplish anything in this game, so try to work with your team. Also every now and then you will run into a jerk here and there(more like every game) but just ignore it and continue to be better than them. If you enjoy this game you might want to look into others like it, such as league of legends and smite. I wrote this review a while back but now looking back on it i realized i left out a good description of the actual gameplay and a list of the pros and cons. So here i am to fix that. I will start off with the pros and cons and then if you want to know how the game works read the following paragraphs/really extended sentences. Pros: -Really cool heroes -108+ people to play as. (they are continuing to make more) -Can run on high end computers as well as low, but on low end (meaning cheap) the graphics quality will be lacking but the game will still be quite playable. -Beautiful spell effects and cool noises -Somewhat interactive landscape. (YOU CAN EAT TREES!!!) -Very balanced games provided you choose your hero wisely. -No two matches will ever be quite the same. (but some can be stressful) -Many different roles to fulfill -Can report unsavory teamates, as well as commend friendly or helpful ones. (can be rewarded based on commendations or penalized based on reports.) -You can select the regions that you would like to play in, making matchmaking somewhat quicker and reduce the chance for lag. -Better than League of Legends... and Smite. Cons: -BIG ONE: even though your region settings are in your area and language set for english (or whatever you are set for.) you can very easily end up in a team where up to half or your entire team is speaking chinese, spanish and russian. this makes that game very difficult for you and infuriating as you stare at some spanish dude run into the enemy and feed them. -Though the lag is somewhat rare when it happens it is normally very bad timing and is impossible to do anything until the spike is over. -VERY MANY PEOPLE WHO THINK THEY KNOW WHAT THEIR DOING AND DON'T AND WHEN YOU TRY TO COMMUNICATE WITH THEM THEY CURSE YOU AND TELL YOU THAT YOU ARE "NOOB"....*pants*... you will run into like two at least every 1-3 games. but the good news is that there are good people out there. -Very hard for beginners. (try to find a person who has alot of hours on dota and friend them and ask for advice) -Tuturial didnt help much. (this may have changed) -Beyond those i cannot think of more cons at the moment. Hopefully this next segment will give you some insight on how dota works. Before you even open the game up have this in mind, You need to learn ALL of the heroes and how they work!. First off, this game is a birds-eye view moba strategy game. For those poor souls who dont know what this means these games typically have a map that has three lanes, each for different people with different roles. Each team has five people and each person should pick a hero that compliments the others members of your team's playstyle and hampers the enemy team's playstyle. Another thing, this isnt all out warfare, in the beginning of the game there will be small soldier type creeps (creeps are basically this game's mob's) which will run towards the enemy creeps along the lane and fight it out to the death. YOUR JOB is to last hit the enemy creeps if you are the carry, as getting the killing blow on a creep is the only way to gain gold from them. If you are the support your job is to A: harrass the enemy heros so that your carry can safely farm. B: Deny creeps (will explain later) and C: pull your lane back based on the enemie's pushing habits. If you happen to be mid you will be fighting the enemies mid for last hits, usually runes,(will get to this too) and this will take more skill to do normally. When you are mid you are alone in your lane and though takes a bit more skill you are rewarded by gaining more experience than your sidelanes, as they spilt the xp. The area in between the lanes is a big part of the game too, there are nuetral creep camps and shorter paths than through the lanes. Nuetral creep camps are just spots on the map where you can kill creeps for a bit of extra gold and XP and they respawn at every minute if no vision is on them. There are some heroes who can spend their entire game farming in the jungle so that one of their team members can get extra xp and the jungler can set up ganks (ambushes) later on. -To deny creeps is to kill friendly, low healthed creeps before the enemy can gain gold from last hitting it. -Runes spawn at bot sides of the river at each even minute (even 0:00) That was a bit rushed in some areas and a bit extensive in others and I know you wont remember ALL of this.This was just to give you a general rundown of how Dota 2 works but still, I thank you for reading this and I hope my long-winded review didn't bore you.

game-hours: 1635.5
review: The sequel to the immensely popular Warcraft 3 mod. Valve took it over and improved upon it in every way. Graphics, gameplay, online, hero design, balance, music, voice acting, and it's FREEthere is no reason you should be playing Dota 1 over this, unless your computer cannot handle Dota 2. Even being better in every way, they are still loyal to the original Dota 1 players, citing that they will continue updating patches alongside Dota 2. So you get pretty much exactly the same game. It being free is quite a big deal. the way the game makes its revenue is from in-game cosmetics you can costume your hero with, which have zero impact on gameplay. everyone is equalthere is no advantage for having certain cosmetics. all heroes are unlocked from the start, and there is no conceivable advantage that can be achieved by paying for it. This is unique because most of Dota 2's competitors in the genre, like League of Legends for example, have customers paying to unlock certain heroes and attribute bonuses to higher level players. you can see how that can deeply affect gameplay unfairly. All those things being said, this is not an easy game by any means. It's quite difficult. A huge portion of the population have been playing this game for years, be it from Dota 1 or its close cousins. It's not like any first person shooter, adventure, racing, fighting, or puzzle game. It's almost like the board game of video games. Mostly strategy involved, meaning you need to have tons of experience to know all the ins and outs of this game. All in all, it's free, try it and play some bot or tutorial matches, if it's too difficult or foreign, at least you've seen what the hype is about. if you're curious for more and get hooked like the most of us, you won't remember what you played before.

game-hours: 996.3

game-hours: 2020.8
review: good
game-hours: 2887.6
review: It all started as a map for Warcraft 3. Today, it is the best of its kind around. Not too surprising to be honest, valve games are usually astonishing. Dota 2 is no exception, it is a complete work of art in many ways. Graphics. This game has a slight cartoonish feel to it with fitting colors and lovely particle effects. It is not too demanding but at the same time not that easy to run, an average computer should be able to handle it. The skill effects for Dota 2 are incredible well made and satisfying while not crossing the border of being disorienting. Sound. Incredible soundtrack with many fitting masterpieces for different situations and places. Skill sounds have a great oomph to them and are very well made overall. What i absolutely love about Dota 2 when it comes to sound would be the voices, hero voices. This game has the greatest voice acting i have ever seen in my life, not only limited to video games. The lines are incredible well thought of. The so called "Responses" in the game of Dota 2 are full of different expressions. They are the main thing that is funny about this game. Gameplay. Dota 2 takes alot of skill, almost too much. Don't jump into public games if you just started, even if you played the original or other ARTS games. Practice all heroes, learn their skills and their playstyles. If you don't know if your enemy can jump right in your face or summon a black hole right in the middle of your team, you will not be performing very well. Controls in Dota 2 are not as hard as the gameplay itself. The generic skill buttons are Q, W, E and R. D and F are also used for heroes who use more than 4 skills. No worries veterans, you can use the legacy hotkeys in Dota 2. When it comes to the actual gameplay, Dota 2 is more of a strategy game than some sort of action game much like the typical RTS game. You need to plan out your game and change up your plans according to the match you are playing. One really important thing about Dota 2 would be teamwork. Without teamwork, you cannot do anything past your first few matches. This game is built on working as a team and is best played as a 5-man team. Items. Dota 2, like TF2, has items. These items are purely cosmetic and have absolutely no gameplay advantages that come with them. Dota 2 is a competitive game and if you put a pro player with 6000 hours into Dota 2 with someone who never played Dota 2 before against eachother, the only thing to matter is skill and teamwork. There are absolutely no perks or runes as you have in League of Legends. Not even miniscule bonuses. Everyone is equal. The items in this game are made by the community. You can make your own items and if they make it into the game, you will actually earn money from this game. Dota 2 items can be sold and bought from the steam marketplace. If a set is 13 dollars on the Dota 2 Store, you can buy it for 2 dollars on the marketplace. Other. The HUD and main menu for this game are very well made. While the HUD is rather big, it is actually pretty small compared to the amount of information it holds. The main menu is well made and easy to navigate at most cases. The matchmaking system for this game is not too bad but is rather lacking. You will experience alot of difficulties caused by foreign players as you will not be able to communicate with them. It is best to get used to being matched with russians when you are playing on US East servers with the English language setting. Dota 2 has a report system as well as a commend system. The report system is rather flawed as people can easily banned for things they didn't do but still the amount of times this happens is rather low. Punishments for getting reported would be Low priority which i will explain later and a Communication Ban which disables a bunch of your communication features and limits some. Low priority makes you get matched slower and disabled earing battle points ( EXP for your profile ) and items during gameplay. Final: Dota 2 is a Valve masterpiece, can be played for years to come once you get past the learning curve.

review: NICE
game-hours: 332.5
review: Dota 2 has a rather large learning curve but don't let that put you off. You can start by playing against increasingly difficult bots and then play against other people. If you're new, the game will rank you against players with a similar skill level. Finding a group of friends to play with will really enhance the learning process and give you some good laughs. The game itself is incredibly fun and there is always more to learn. Not only is the game free to play but all the heroes are too. The only items which cost any moeny are optional cosmetic items. The community can be unforgiving at times, however the game allows you to mute other players and lets you communicate via a series of informative 'pings' if you so choose. Anyone who is really offensive can be reported for their behaviour. If you are looking for a game to play long-term, where you can have fun with friends but equally, see your time pay off with definite increases in your skill level, then this is for you. Go on, give it a go!

game-hours: 730.6
review: So. Many. Heroes.... But the tutorial helps. Suggest you take Dragon Knight, Skeleton King or Drow Ranger and play vs bots a few times. Learn what items to buy. Learn to run away constantly. You should never die! You should rarely even get hit by the creeps (the army of monsters that endlessly comes out of the enemy base). Your job is to level up quickly and efficiently so you're ready to face the enemy heroes when they hit 6th or so and come to murder you. When you graduate to real players, everything you've learned about enemy hero behavior from the bots goes out the window but hopefully you've learned to play your heroes pretty well by now. This game is a blast with friends vs bots or real people if you and your friends are accomplished. The community used to be pretty nasty/unforgiving but they have improved and the developers have made such a beautiful interface/tutorial system it's very inviting now. Highly recommend for anyone.

review: !
game-hours: 4237.6
review: Quick and simple overview: 4200 hrs logged + 400 second account. I gave this a thunbs down so people reading the negetive comments can get a more accruate description of issues and read the positives. Active players 10/10 Community 8/10 Game breaking issues bugs(none) 9/10 Enjoyment (MOBA) 10/10 Overall- 9/10 PROS: 1) *Rewards the player for the effort placed into the game.* Very challenging game to play/learn. How willing you are to do reserch(online) and sit in created games to practice combos/lh ect.. will dictate how well you will progress. 2) *Easy to jump right into with a group of friends.* If you have a group of friends that play it can be very fun to LEARN tegether. 3) **It is a competative enviroment** if you are a competative person this is the game for you. 4) **A lot of classes of heros to choose from** over 100. Although some are better then others every hero in the right/wrong situation can be very useful or bad. 5) **NOT A PAY TO WIN GAME**... Doesn't even nickle and dime you to death. You pay for HUDs, skins, loading screens ect; But, nothing that can affect how well players play or others. 6) **Dev's are quick to respond to issues on offical forums** They also fix them in a timly manner. CONS: 1) **A lot of reserch and guided practice is NEEDED to be decent at this game.** This might be a bummer for those who like to d/l and game and insta win.... If this is you stay away...far away 2) **The "guantlet" most mmr players need to go through".** This "guantlet" consist of other people players will be teamed up with that will troll, not speak your selceted language, or just not give a damn about your game. These people tend to ruin games and will hinder advancement in the MMR (ranked) or hidden mmr (un-ranked) system. The "guantlet" consist of the lower tiers usually low hidden mmr and 1-2.8k MMR area. It is possible to pass the guantlet but a lot of practice is needed or you can party with friends. 3) **Server Issues** Everynow and then they will have laggy servers or down networks randomly but a restart of steam or a bathroom break easily solves these uncommon issues.

review: Dota 2, Is a very addicting MOba and has done a near perfect job in succeeding it predecessor Mod in World of Warcraft Defence of The Ancients. The graphics are badass, the characters have a sence of personality in the voice acting when the banter or comment on their death or another character. The styles of skill and builds is very vast, you could easily become lost in the different ways you could master a single heroe let alone the other 100. It is an excellent way to pass time, with games ranging from 15 minutes to almost 2 hours. Most people I know lose track of time and continue playing through the entire night till morning, when they finaly relize the time as the sun piercess their curtains and hits their faces. The game is so great that I personaly spend days in solitude, under my blanket in a dark room, with my laptop trying to ward Riki. So if you have alot of time and no mom to scream at you every 5 minutes and you like MOba styled games DOTA 2 is for you. Just a word of advice though, never play a game when there are ther people in your home that may distract you in the middle of a game, because they will most likely summon you when you about to go on a godlike kill streak. And then while your gone you will most likely get reported or be gone for over 5 minutes and get disconnected and before you know it you get an abondone trying to reconnect. Following that you may end up throwing you pc or laptop out the window or attempt to execute the person who caused this. Out of 10 this game recieves 9 because of how broken some heroe builds can be. Oh yes and please excuse my spelling errors. :) GLHV
game-hours: 633.0
review: An excellent MOBA, and there's little wonder that it's the most popular game on Steam at the moment. The fact that the 100+ heroes are unlocked off the start means that there's plenty of gameplay variety even if the actual modes are a bit lacking, and the amount of depth is pretty staggering. Saying that, the community is absolutely wretched, and undoubtably the worst part of the game. This is the type of game where the more sensitive among us will want to turn off voice and text chat in order to enjoy some hassle-free fun. The free-to-play model is perhaps the best in the industry, even better than TF2's, and you can play the entire game without spending a cent and not feel restricted in any way compared to a paying player. Truly a mastercraft in just about every regard.

review: Well it's good but not as good as i expected it to be, the graphics are kinda lame and the items are extremely expensive compared to League of Legends wich is nearly the exact the same game. And people that plays Dota 2 says that League of Legends sucks and it's easier, well it's not. I think Dota 2 isn't harder AT all! And here is some bad things about Dota 2: 1. It takes 1,3 seconds to turn around in the game. 2. as i said, the graphics are lame. 3. Overly expensive items in-game. 4. The only thing that's harder is the login screen compared to League of Legends, it's uneccesairy hard. 5. The champs are pretty easy to handle 6. the ranged champions has such an long range its not fair, they can nearly shoot you from 10 meters, if you think meters in-game. Good things: 1. It has a great selection of heroes. 2. Skins are cheap and looks good. 3. You don't have to go back to the base to buy items though. 4. you can heal yourself by eating trees xD. I've tried this game about 2 hours to see what's good and bad and if i recommend it or not. And i say that i would not recommend it to you guys. But some of you may like when it's harder to get items (more expensive) instead of getting OP so fast And i won't judge. But i still think you would like League of Legends better because the champs are better made and the map is easier to learn + the minimap in Dota 2 is kinda weird i've noticed. And the minimap is bad because it's kinda blurred and way to small. Bad about the Heroes: 1 . There are some heroes that's way too op. For example: I was just walking around with half hp and then a lightning guy came and onehit when i was still supertanky, it's really unfair! 2. They can take very long before nerfing a hero. Good about the Heroes. 1. The bad heroes can still turn good if the player knows how to build the hero, and outplay the good heroes 2. heroes can say to you when you're out of mana, wich is nice. When playing first game: I recommend going to a lane that's supposed to be 2 in it so you dont have to solo, Focus on farming and eating trees to regenerate health, for items you should first buy what the champion are made to be, expample: a tank needs health items and an assasin need damage items. Play safe and don't be too agressive. I'n late game you must focus on kills and towers so that you can come into their base, When you're in their base you musn't kill someone as fast as you see them coming, you need to take out the towers. When you took out all the towers in the base you and your team can easily kill them. If they are doing this to your base then you really must stay in the base under a tower and defend the towers. If you're not defending they will win the game. And some tips to become a great player: 1. Go tank or fighter top. Not ranged. 2. As i said, you must focus and play safe, it's never good to play overly agressive. 3. Never go back to the base to buy items. Use the goat, he can bring items to you from the base.

game-hours: 396.8
review: Really now who gives a  about other games when Dota 2 exists? There won't ever be a remotely as hardcore game as Dota 2. I don't understand why you people bother arguing or having discussions about any other game when there won't be a game as comparably good as Dota 2 for another 10-20 years. I'll put my credibility on the line here, and say that Dota 2 is the best game of all time. By "best game of all time", I refer to artistic and technical production, and gameplay design iteration (since Dota is arguably one of the most iterated upon computer game). From a technological rendering standpoint, it's visuals may not be king, but the art assets, overall art direction, and particle effects are the best that I have ever seen. The most excellently, tastefully produced art that I have ever seen in a game. The voice cast is the best I have ever heard, Dota 2 has Duke Nukem (Jon St. John), Cortana (Jen Taylor), Nathan Drake (Nolan North), the entire L4D cast, the entire Half-Life 2 cast, the entire Team Fortress 2 cast, and GlaDOS from Portal. Let's actually get down to the gameplay. No two games I have ever played have felt similar to the point of feeling rote. Each and every hero in Dota 2 is distinctly different from another, offering a uniquely encapsulated experience with well-defined goals for every single playable character in Dota. Because every hero feels so profoundly unique, every game that I play of Dota 2 feels fundamentally different in a way that League of Legends is not able to reproduce. I could go on, and on, but at this point I might as well just make a video essay. My only regret is that I never played Dota on Warcraft 3, because I wasn't really into gaming when I was younger. Now, I have some Dota 2 to play. Dota 2 is seriously a game I could play ad-inifnitum, and never get tired of. Why bother with any other game?

game-hours: 1180.1
review: This game... Well I dont know where to start. For you looking at this game with out even playing it you may see a hero brawler that the objective is to destroy the other teams base but thats not what I saw. When I looked at Dota 2 on steam for the first time I saw an complicated version of classic hero brawler. So I said no screw this ill go play a game that makes sense... So I started playing League of Legends or LoL. Which lasted me about 3 months until I came to a realization that LoL was simply dull. It did not make me think and the people... They just made the game horrible and enjoyable. Sure their was the few great games that truly said this is true teamwork but overall I every time I played a new game I would sigh then choose one of the 3 overly expensive heros I had purchased then stared at the unimpressive dull graphics and then got yelled at my team mate for stealing his creep last hit. So then after staring at the Dota 2 page on steam for a few minutes and watching a few video guides on how to survive as a noob in Dota 2. Finally I pressed download and slowly but surely it downloaded and after have a friend beat the tutorial for me I played my first bot match. After four minutes I quit because it simply just made no sense. I didn't comeback to dota until a friend invited me to play dota and I warned him to be careful because I would probably just feed the other team but he urged me on and forced me to play a bot game. He explained the basics and while me and him coordinated the first blood play I realized the greatness in this game... It was having great friends that you can rely on to pop a healing salve on you right before you did and they save your life or when you and your friend find someone jungling in your jungle so you and him just destroy him with mass damage and you both start laughing but in Dota 2 another great aspect about it is that you must think. You have to react, predict, hope about what may happen to you. I feel i have just gotten started with this game and I already play over 125 hours. Overall Dota 2 Has some Great features that make it step out from some Hero brawler. Likes +Dota 2 has some great Teamwork when you talk +It is a great mind game that helps you with strategy that makes you think +Can be a easy win for you if you just use simple teamwork +Has great graphics compared to most MOBAs Dislikes -Intense learning curve -you can be matched up with a horrible team that just trolls you Overall Score: 8.79

review: SSSVVVVEEEEEEEEENNNNNNNNNNNNNNN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 9/10 Can't wait for tenth player to load in I started playing this game back in March of 2014 My DoTA experience: Day 1: friends who've already played the game for hundreds and hundreds of hours invite me to play with them. I suck, I have no idea why this ing branch is made out of iron and apparently it is important for me to buy it, the map is confusing and am getting killed by creeps, I suck. Day 10: friends tell me to play tutorials and do bot matches to get better and understand the game. I do bot matches and finish the tutorials. I'm beginning to understand how the game works. Day 30: "Summerz, learn to ing last hit you noob!" "I know how to last hit but I don't enjoy it" (This is the kind of  I say when I have no idea how something works) Day 50: "Summerz, you have 150 ing hours now, you should be a pro!" "sorry! sorry!" "do more bot matches and then solo queue you " Day 200: I'm finally getting decent at the game, and am beginning to "specialize" (still ) as a support. I have watched a billion dota how-to's and mlg-plays, I've recently found out how to stack creeps and other support  like that, I realise how important wards and courier are etc... I still suck at the game btw... _________________________________________________________________________________ This game is definitely one of the best MOBAs ever made, and has very good graphics and unlimited hours of gameplay. If you play this game, either start it BY YOURSELF (don't start with semi-pros and above) or start it at the same time your friends start it, so you are all just as experienced with each other. An experienced player is going to  talk you until you are good, this is not helpful, and can actually make things worse, playing by yourself means you are matched with people just as  as you (that previous sentence is actually a lie, the lower down you are level-wise, the more likely you are to be matched with/against a smurf. Other mobas I've played: -Tome:Immortal Arena(For a while, I stopped playing because it was affecting my plays in DoTA) -League of Legends (For about 5 minutes, because I hated it, very, very, very much....) Side effects of playing DotA 2: - Magnet -Russian Accent -Sudden hatred for LoL -You will think you are MLG -Depression -Euphoria -You will hate every other culture in existence that doesn't speak or write in English By the way, who the  is this riki guy I keep hearing about? Never seen him before, is he a new character being added in the 2015 international? P.S: I'm pretty sure the government is watching me because of the amount of times I've typed ALLAH TECHBAR into my computer, I've had a red dot sitting on my forehead for about 2 months now. P.P.S: I used to have a life, can you believe that?!

game-hours: 1491.1
review: recommend
game-hours: 1654.4
review: Dota is a competitive game of action and strategy, played both professionally and casually by millions of passionate fans worldwide. Players pick from a pool of over a hundred heroes, forming two teams of five players. Radiant heroes then battle their Dire counterparts to control a gorgeous fantasy landscape, waging campaigns of cunning, stealth, and outright warfare. Irresistibly colorful on the surface, Dota is a game of infinite depth and complexity. Every hero has an array of skills and abilities that combine with the skills of their allies in unexpected ways, to ensure that no game is ever remotely alike. This is one of the reasons that the Dota phenomenon has continued to grow. Originating as a fan-made Warcraft 3 modification, Dota was an instant underground hit. After coming to Valve, the original community developers have bridged the gap to a more inclusive audience, so that the rest of the world can experience the same core gameplay, but with the level of polish that only Valve can provide. Get a taste of the game that has enthralled millions.

game-hours: 2118.6
review: Very GOOD!
game-hours: 98.3
review: With so many MOBAs out there. Which one is the best? Well I can't answer that question for you, but I can tell you how great this game is. First off, this game has a steep learning curve, so if you prefer mindless action games, then this isn't for you. Once you get past the learning curve however, that's when things start to get really fun. Dive in to this action packed game as you battle other people across 3 lanes in a team based enviroment. There is literally next to no grinding in this game, everyone starts at level 1 in each game, so the only real question is, how far are you willing to go to become the best? Watch other people play with in the in-built game viewer, and study a libary of heroes as you progressively become better. Don't worry about people calling you a noob when you first play, because they were also noobs once! Just ignore them and enjoy the rest of the game.

review: Incredibly addicting. The gameplay itself is fun and engaging. It is played with a team of 5 characters with unique sets of skills and abilities versus another group. It is definitely a team effort to win the game. A single match would take about 40 to 60 minutes. Customization of some aspects of the game adds another spice to the in-game play. Characters costume sets, items, screensvers and skins and other DLC's which can be bought or traded at the Steam Market would keep the avid player own the characters. Over all the game is exciting and fun. I give it 10 out of 10.

game-hours: 2048.9
review: If you're just a mere casual player looking for something to that you can use to kill time, then turn back now as Dota 2 is not the game for you. Dota 2 is unrivaled when it comes to balance, and competiveness. You will seldom come across a video game that requires as much cooperation and teammork, and let's not forget thlat is also unrivaled for being brutally unforgiving. New comers will undoubtly struggle, and the learning curve will sure drive away many new players but those who prevail will have experience one of the greatest possible experiences they will come across in gaming. Dota 2 is all about tactics and strategy. Everything you do or purchase from the in-game shop will have a significant effect on the outcome of the game, for good or worse. It is also where creativity with unconvential hero drafts or unorthodox item builds can either make you or break you, this is what makes Dota 2 so great. Getting into every aspect and detail into the game would require more than just a few paragraphs as this game is so immese and in-depth. I am writing this review almost with under 2,000 hours of gameplay under my belt, and I am not ashamed to say I am no master or expert, to the contrary actually I am just an average Dota 2 gamer who still questions himself, will I ever stop playing this game? Will Dota 2 ever get boring and old? I doubt it.

game-hours: 3131.3
review: Dota 2 is the spiritual successor to the Warcraft III: The Frozen Throne custom game "Defense of the Ancients: Allstars," in which the player controls a single hero unit in a battle to level up, collect loot, and destroy the enemy's structures, all within a typical 30-45-minute experience. Games can be longer or shorter, but typically fall within that window. As the metagame has changed due to content update patches, games have grown shorter over the years, but in the past, Dota was likened to "World of Warcraft in an hour." It is an accurate analogy, as the player experiences many traditional RPG elements while competing head-to-head against other players. Dota 2 is an incredibly complex, strategy-driven, competitive game. With over 100 individual, unique heroes from which to choose, as well as a variety of different game modes to mix up the drafting process, each game is an experience unto itself. No two games will ever be identical. The one thing standing in the way of most players new to the genre of MOBAs is the unforgiving nature of the game. For better or worse, each mistake a player makes can be critical in the final outcome of the game, especially as the clock ticks on. In a couple of seconds, the entire tide of the game could swing heavily from one team to the other's if even one costly mistake is made. As a result of this, many players have developed a rather distasteful attitude toward others when mistakes are made. A word that is often thrown around is "toxic," which isn't inaccurate; the toxicity of the community can be a terrible deterrent to new players, and can actively inhibit growth of the game. Thankfully, Valve have implemented ways in which to curb these behaviors through punishments dished out to players with nasty attitudes. Each player is given a number of "reports" per week, which can be issued against other players who have exhibited poor form, rudeness, excessive communication spam, or other infractions, and as a player accrues reports, he or she may face a communication mute or a number of games in the "low priority" queue, which is sort of like rehabilitation back into society. While I have spent a lot of time talking about the negative aspects of the game, I want to stress that I have been playing Dota since 2004, and I don't see a stopping point in sight even yet. I am consistently captivated by the dynamic and interesting nature of the game, of each individual game, to offer me a unique, fun, and rewarding trade-off for my time commitment. There are few feelings in gaming as satisfying and enjoyable as coming away from a game with a hard-fought win against other players with good attitudes. It makes the bad stuff seem trivial by comparison. In addition to the actual gameplay elements explored in this review, Dota 2 is part of the greater Steam Trading community, a collective of games featuring in-game economies and persistent item storage for players through the Steam platform. Even if you don't particularly like the game itself, item trading from player-to-player can be tremendously rewarding and fun, and if you're lucky, you could find yourself with an item worth up to many thousands of dollars. Of course, with any relatively free market, there will be unsavory and dishonest individuals out there who will not blink an eye before attempting to scam you, rip you off, or otherwise take advantage of you. Thankfully, there are plenty of resources available to new traders, so do your research! In fact, if you need help, don't be afraid to add me directly and fire away. I'm always happy to help. In conclusion, Dota and Dota 2 are without a doubt the games on which I have spent the most time playing. Each new game brings me a new, exciting experience, and as long as you remind yourself to maintain a positive attitude and resist the urge to treat your fellow player with disrespect, you will agree that it is among the best multiplayer experiences available anywhere. Learn it, love it, and play on!

review: FYI: Dota stands for Defense of the Ancients Hello Ladies and Germs! Today you are looking at Dota 2 Review! Dota used to be a gamemode in Warcraft 3! It was so Popular it went on steam! If you haven't played Dota 2 or Warcraft 3 Dota then this review will help you out! First of all Dota 2 IS NOT A FIRST PERSON SHOOTER GAME. It is a strategy game so if you do not like strategy games or you just suck at it then don't play it plz. The Goal of the game is theres 3 Towers on each 3 Sides. Fight your way and Destory the Radiant's/Dire's Ancient and you will win the game! It's a 5V5 Game so you need to rely on your team too. There are 3 types of heroes: Strength, Agility, and Intelligence. Strength are really tanky which means they have more health and less mana, they are also mostly nukers, pusher, etc. Agilitys depends on items so most of them are carrys which means they farm. Intelligence have lots of mana and most of them are supports because most of them can trap, heal, etc. But most intelligence heroes are squishy (means they can die easily, example: Crystal Maiden (idk if i spelled it right lol)).

game-hours: 868.0
review: Valve distributes "pillbox" model free-to-play, that is, to try his hand in the game is completely free. Commercial developers' interest is primarily due to the operation of the gaming market for buying and selling a variety of accessories for the characters. Occasionally cosmetic bun drop at the end of the match for free. Much more often players get chests with hidden treasures, the key to which you can buy in the store Dota 2. Decoration characters - a purely personal matter. Buying things does not affect the balance sheet, so that in general all the charm of "bunkers" are available to everyone. Investments do not open new gameplay possibilities, as is done, for example, in the League of Legends. Ultimately, the outcome of the match is always open to the professional level player. If someone is not familiar with the concept of Dota, briefly sketch it. The teams of Light and Darkness task is to destroy the enemy base. The composition of each party consists of five characters, one of which management is performed by the player. Also they are involved in a battle "creeps" - weak "units", follows a simple algorithm to go on a given route and kill oncoming enemies. For the destruction of heroes and creeps players get money and experience, who spend on the development of his character. It is here that concluded the full potential of "bunkers". Heroes in the game for more than a hundred. For the successful outcome of the match is not enough to choose a character, you liked visually. Proven in one battle hero can be completely useless in another. Everything, from the choice of the ward to set items purchased must assume the existence of a comprehensive plan for the match. Any action requires serious analysis of the situation during the game. Every decision is situational, and success depends entirely on your ability to correctly calculate the potential opponent to see major trumps his team "peak" and predict the course of battles. The longer you play, the more opportunities disclosed. Over time, you realize that "bunker" implies a simple but brilliant concept. Dota 2 Seven one waiting. And very often do not wait. Plot as such in Dota 2 no. Some event-background is rooted in the world of WarCraft 3. Only thing that can amuse themselves histories lovers - small biographical summary for each of the characters. However, the knowledge of these facts does not affect the gameplay. change the wallpaper The concept map, heroes - all migrated to the Dota 2 is almost unchanged. Yes, and what changes can we talk on the "bunkers"? The structure of the gameplay is strictly defined, and any attempt to bring conceptual innovation is fraught with loss of balance. Mindful of the fact that the cart does not need a fifth wheel, Valve neatly confined to some cosmetic innovations. First, Dota 2 as an independent project, has got a stylish menu that offers quick access to the game itself, store, news, as well as the creation of guides and translations professional matches. All the opportunities provided by the developers, organized very convenient, greatly reducing the barrier to entry for newcomers. For them the same way, a special education campaigns where they can, without spoiling the old residents of the nerves, to master the basic principles of playing different characters. After that - welcome to the expanses of the team battles. At the moment, there are seven game modes, in which the differences relate solely homepage of the match - the choice of heroes. For those who simply want to have fun and hone their management skills specific character fit popular All Pick. For "Daughtery" with professional ambitions preferable Captain's Mode, in which more tactical depth of the game is revealed. Anyway, interest in the proceedings increases proportionally to the number of familiar people in the team, because only with them possible quality "team play." Dota 2 "Loaf, loaf, anyone you choose!" As for the gameplay, then we have good old "bunker", modified only visually. From medieval graphics WarCraft 3 left pixel and - characters look a lot more colorful than the first part, pleasant texture pleasing to the eye, each character has its own set of animations, all the effects are traced in detail and spectacular. Often, during a particularly massive battles, replete with an abundance of picture paints at which you lose the essence of what is happening. But overall graphics looks cool and is not satisfactory. The same goes for the voice acting. All characters engaging in activities unique voice give one of the harvested phrases. The spirit of the Games memorable soundtrack that Valve recorded using a full orchestra. Also, the developers involved in the game interesting chip: passing in silence match climactic battle moments of "heated" disturbing music. If we talk about very very small things that have changed the characteristics of certain abilities and artifacts, a couple of characters renamed. Number of the latter, incidentally, is constantly increasing - Valve regularly replenishes list missing characters from the first part and even threatens to create new heroes. Cancers to be boiled. alive Another nice feature of the new "DotA" is a system of storing statistics. All your defeat and victory shall be accounted for and matches are recorded so you can review your or someone else's game, having studied the "replay". Here you will find a very interesting camera mode, allowing for the match as he went on the monitor who was playing. Fog of War, mouse movement - a very useful feature for those who wish to master such heroes like Mipo or puja. Dota 2 Dying ogre - a sad spectacle. Valve also tried to create an advanced ranking system. During the matches are levels that are nominally rated player skill. Opponents with whom you are dealing with will meet your performance that should ideally create balance. In reality, however, some special factory new accounts in Steam, so start writing your stats from scratch or wait a low priority resulting from complaints (yes, the selection of the ideal community is held in the form of "reportov" which players throw each other). As a result, the Cubs first infantrymen entered in the "bunker", meet experienced "grandfathers" ready without any hints to explain who is who. So the problem autobalance not yet solved. Somewhat hampered by having fun and inadequate behavior of the individual gamers, which, incidentally, is largely played a major role in the folding of the special status of "bunkers". Although theoretically fans flunk Chat trite platitudes and rough netsenzurschinoy should be in the low-priority games that will have to deal with their own kind, however the level of aggression here rolls. However, this is by no means a disadvantage of the game. Reasons for this lie, as they say, somewhere in time and morals. Dota 2 Forest "farm" - a relatively safe way to get hold of experience and gold. Setting aside the problems of the community and popular mythology psevdointellektualnoy gaming abductor "pillbox" place exclusively in the consumer diet shkoloty, it must be admitted that Dota 2 is a surprisingly balanced development. In creation Valve she finally acquired all the necessary attributes independent game: decent appearance, great music and teaching campaign. Before us "bunker" is selected from the parental nest WarCraft 3 with its own feathers and spread its wings. Only appreciate her flight for some reason, not all are willing. P.S. All gameplay features are available free of charge; nice graphics; user-friendly interface; great music and sound.

review: The few hundred hours i've spent with this game has been spent in public lobbies and some bot matches. It's great. Gameplay is Solid, There's enough diversity in playstyles to make any tactitian weep with joy. Though the community might not always be "Top Notch", there are a lot of people out there who are really looking forward to a good time, wether you are new to the game or not. Sure there are bugs. Sure there are some unbalanced heroes and items. Sure there's the occaisonal right , but if you are going to play a game that has near constant connection to the untamed internet and its hordes of demonic flamers and trolls, your gonna have to walk over that bridge, wether the troll likes it or not. The artstyle is appealing to the eye and the combat is vibrant with epic style animations and effects. Don't get me wrong, the Combat FEELS Good, but it LOOKS even better. There is no Pay-To-Win, which is what makes this a real 1# Place titel for me. The HUD Is Grounded in what works and has none of what doesnt. There's even a little toturial to explain the base game mechanics (with the exeption of runes and items). Overall, the game left me impressed and a few few cents short after those beautiful visual clothing sets i bought (just a few, I Swear) What i'm trying to say is that youre experience with this game is what you make of it. Wether its going to be playing for the team, a lone wolf, a team tank or something in the middle, its up to you wether your'e going to enjoy it, or decide it's not for you and so for me so far, Its Been One Helluve Ride....

review: Review of Dota 2 //STORYLINE The story is about a father (The ancient), and his kidnapped daughter (Roshan). The objective for the two teams is to either save Roshan and bring her to her father, or kill Roshan, if you do that, well... yeah.. //GRAPHICS Graphics are very bad. If you take a look at it's main competitor League of Legolas, you can see that that game has put much more effort into graphics and try and make it look very serious, and not cartoony or any of that . //GAMEPLAY Gameplay is very standard to an FPS. The characters you play as are not very varying, and they are all pretty much the same. But a very innovative thing is that when you win, you get very unique awards such as extra copies of the game, or different looking loading screens! But if you loose you will get punished with such things as the game will uninstall by itself (ask my good friend Difikoll about this, he has experienced it alot). //FINAL VERDICT It is a very unique FPS game so if you can afford it (60 USD), it is definetly worth buying. I give this game 6/9 joints.

review: nice
game-hours: 338.2
review: Defense of the Ancients 2 - known more colloquially as DotA 2 - is a masterpiece of modern video game design. Harkening back to the age-old StarCraft 1 custom map Aeon of Strife, DotA 2 nearly perfects the elements introduce in that original mod. The mechanics and gameplay are ageless, simple in their implementation and flawless in their execution. Everything about Dota 2 is a triumph of engineering - the individual Heroes have fantastic character designs, both thematically and mechanically, and the game is perfectly balanced around its seemingly lack of scaling and at times stagnant nature. It is a game where Levels and Planning take precedent over Gold Advantage and Items, and teamwork is a union - a celebration, even - of independent player skill. This variety of complex mechanics, themes, and interactions that coalesce into a truly unique experience. I recall the time I forgot to Ward bot rune, and when mid lost Illusion to a Pudge from top lane, I was only blamed four times, as opposed to dozens in other, similar competing games. This unparalelled level of community benevolence and powerful inclination towards skillful play make DotA 2 the best game on the market, if not all of Human History. Four hundred years from now, when the Paragon Hyperscholars are uploading DigiEdu to the modbrains of the Neo Bourgeoisie, Dota 2 will forever be imbedded in the SiliconCortex as the zenith of PreHuman ingenuity. 0/10 it sucks

game-hours: 593.5
review: Defense of the Ancients 2 (DotA 2) is by far one of the best games you can play, especially if you enjoyed League of Legends. The difference between the latter game and the former (aside from the obvious, such as developer), is the fact that DotA 2 reinvents the game and innovates it by giving it the Valve touch. Not only are the Heroes (the equivalent of "Champions" in LoL) all fun to play and the other players fun to play with, but the system of commendation, reporting, leveling, and item acquirance are all unique and effectively made. Overall, this is an amazing game to play and once you try it out (and you undoubtedly will try it out at some point), you'll be glad you did.
game-hours: 38.4
review: Dota 2 is many things to many people: it's a great way to kill an afternoon with friends; it's a spectator sport platform with its own item-betting scene; it's a hobby; it's a profession, and a way to make a living. It isn't perfect and likely never will be, as each update tends to fix bugs and introduce new ones, and the tutorial could certainly use some work. However, with zero cost to play and one of the highest skill ceilings of any game I've ever encountered, Dota 2 is a modern multiplayer masterpiece.

review: GGWP
game-hours: 1650.5
review: What can I say? After 1000 hours I still feel unwelcome in the obnoxious community and still get absolutely stomped, but I just cannot put this masterpiece down. Defense of the Ancients was a pioneer of the Moba genre and it's sequel remains a strong contender with the likes of Smite and League of Legends. Dota 2 offers a pool of over 100 absolutely free heroes and both a casual and competitive approach. However you choose to play the game you'll be met with an array of toxic, cussing and hateful individuals who will trash talk and rage at you for the simplest mistake. A thick skin is necessary to obtain full enjoyment out of Dota 2. Ignoring the savage community, Dota 2 has perhaps the most engaging, entertaing and satisfying gameplay ever. It feels amazing to initiate a succesful teamfight or to just win a close game. Most heroes are balanced meaning most victories are owed to the skills of the players, however a keen sense of mechanics knowledge is mandatory due to the game's reliance on different damage types and various other integral factors. Whilst it can be difficult as a new player, persistence and resilience can introduce you to many hours of fun. For the best possible experience, playing with friends will both save you from hateful people and allow you to synergise your strategies. Dota 2 is free, so you have nothing to lose from buying it except maybe your social life.

review: Game for top gentlemen
game-hours: 407.6
review: Dota 2 like all the other MOBA's are hard to review. Mainly because the community. The game itself is pretty smooth and really likeable, there are tons of characters right at the beginning, with plenty of builds for each one. A huge point is the in-game "build seeker" where you can apply a selected build for your character and after that point the game will suggest which skill must leveling and which item need to buy to be succes. It's a must feature have for newcomers! Wait, there is more! After all match the system will give presents to the players, however mostly these are just cosmetics for the characters, but with that you can customize the look of your favorite dude and top of that, if you don't need these items you can sell it on the market! The replay tool is also a nice touch. And now comes the dark side... No matter how good is the game, when the playmates ruins it. For me it's really hard to get a good team in pub, mainly because i play on EU-West and well... hmpf. So we have a hard time with the Ukrainians. :) It's far more better if you gather 4 of your friends and play together. Other than that, if i just compare the game itself with other MOBA's i can't anything say, this is the best. 8,5/10

review: Hardcore strategy game. I want my life back
game-hours: 63.1
review: This game is great,it just needs good teamwork with team.Lovely. A+++
game-hours: 1311.7
review: Dota2 is hard to pick up, it has quite the learning curve. Completing the tutorial will not get you ready for online play, and like any team based game you'll get a lot of negative feedback from your team mates just for being new. Don't let this discourage you! Everyone started fresh at some point, take it with a grain of salt. There are over a hundred heros to choose from. I recommend playing a few games, seeing who does well and what you like about that here, then looking for other heros to start playing with. There are great hero tutorials all over the internet, if you have your eye on someone, check out a video of a pro playing them. It'll help you understand what makes that hero great. Dota2 is a great game, and I've met some really cool people in my short time playing. Practice makes perfect, and this game is no exception.

game-hours: 677.0
review: >Picks chen >Spam test of faith >rage insues >reported to hell >0 k 20 d >gg wp 10/10 "It's ok"
game-hours: 249.7
review: Dota 2 is by far the hardest to learn game I have ever played. However, it is one of the most fun. If you're new to Dota, and you want to get better, you have three options: 1. Practice bot games over and over using a ton of guides and such until you can consistantly beat unfair bots no problem. 2. Play a ton of games with more experienced friends (this way is the most fun). Make sure that they're close friends, because they will teach you, but if you don't listen to them and keep dying or buying bad items or whatever, they'll hate playing with you. So listen to your teachers! 3. Play games on your own and try your best, and end up being yelled at by four different people at the same time (9 if you're lucky). But if you get through the learning phase, this game becomes amazing. It's an awesome strategic game to play with friends. You'll win some and you'll lose some, but it's free and fun, so what the heck.

review: Dota 2 is one of those games that gets better every time I play it. Even though it's played on the same map every time, every game is still different one way or another. There are over 100 heroes to play as, which makes the game incredibly complex. I've put about 100 hours in to Dota 2, and I still have no idea what half of them do. Some focus on healing, others focus on beating the crap out of everything. It's a fun and frustrating game, but mostly fun. It has a giant learning curve, so prepare to put alot of time into this one. The game is excellent. (9/10 or 90%)

game-hours: 465.4
review: Dota 2 is a free to play competitive MOBA game with minor micro transactions (for outfits etc.) by Valve. The game has become the most popular game on Steam and that's for a reason. The gameplay is smooth and easy to learn. The characters are all different and have a lot of variety in them and unlike in League of legends, you don't actually have to unlock all the heroes, you just simply get them all from the get-go. Dota is really easy to get a grasp on...or so it was for me. I've seen some people complain about the game being too difficult and that it has a high learning curve, but I beg to differ. It's easy if you've played games similiar to this in the past. The matches last for about 30-40 minutes on average (my longest match was about 70 minutes), which sometimes prevents me from playing the game if I don't have a lot of time in my hands. So remember to preserve some time before you start a match because disconnecting too many times will get you penalised and you won't be getting any dota points. The community can cause you a problem if you're having trouble dealing with hatred and pubertic Russian virgins (NO OFFENCE) ranting to you for stealing their kill every once and a while. If that is not the case then you should be fine. And of course, not everybody on the internet is mean...you can meet some very nice people there too and the game is at it's best when everyone works together and respects one another. The game is great for online play with friends too. I've played Dota 2 for over a 100 hours and I still try to play it at least once a day. I definitely recommend this game to everyone who's interested...why not it's free and that's all that matters, right... you dweeb. I sincerely thank Valve for giving us yet another amazing game to waste our miserable lifes and hard earned coins in. 9/10!

review: One of the best multiplayer games I've played in a long time. DOTA 2 is set up in a way that encourages both epic cooperation and friendly competition. With over 80 heroes to choose from, there's a playstyle for everyone. I would have gladly paid over $30 for a game like this, but probably the awesomest part is that its totally free, and, technically, with dedication, one could unlock every single item in the game without having to pay a penny. Probably the best free-to-play model I've seen so far in a game. If you're looking for an awesome, strategic, epic, free game to play with friends, pick up DOTA 2. You won't regret it.

review: Now lots of people can jab at dotas fundamental flaw, you all know this one... the wonderfull communty. And i understand your pain of being relentlessly insulted for your noob actions but let us all remember this game is a team game and of coarse the weakest link can break the strength of the unit. game-hours: 437.7
review: Dota 2 is a competitive game. The community is toxic, and the community mutates you into the same form of toxic they are. There are people with so much more gameplay time than me, and so much more skill than me. I am constantly reminded of this whenever I play with my friends, in which everyone seems better than me. Yet it doesn't stop me, and it makes every kill, every triumph and every rare so much more satisfying and exciting to earn than if I played on my own against people of my own ability. I can't recommend or not recommend the game, but for the sakes of uploading I'll recommend the game. If you have doubts about playing Dota 2, put them aside and give the game ago. Rally the bangouts if you know any and try to learn the game. It may take forever, or it may take you a few months, everyone experiences Dota slightly differently. Regardless of how you experience Dota 2, remember that if you don't like it, you have many other PC games to play instead of it. Just remember to play Dota 2 at least once or twice. It is free, what do you have to lose by trying and hating it? Overall: <Enter your score here> In short: A massive learning curve separates you from a game that has destroyed careers, academic lives and social lives, while giving a small number of people multi-million dollar careers. If it can do this, it must have something good in it.

review: Dota 2 is a game that is horrific at first but gradually gets better more you play. The main thing that makes Dota 2 a good game is the equality of classes. There are around 30 different people that you can choose to be before starting a game and most of them are as good a choice of being the other as they will all have posotives and negatives attatched to each class. Some classes are better at the start of the game and some at the end. The ones better at the start of the game are called supports and the ones at the end are called carries. There are 3 categories that classes are placed in: agility, intelligence and stamina. Each game lasts approxtimately 30 to 50 mins but occasionally over/under. There are 2 teams of 5 (named Radiant and Dire)and as the game progresses, characters are leveled up by killing al controlled creeps or other heroes or neutrals or runes. I wont explain what any of these are as this is a review not an explanation. There are 2 major problems with Dota 2 and they are firstly there is only one map. The map has been designed to be even and fair but it can get boring after a while. If you leave a match or get reported a certain amount of times then you will get put into low priority meaning that you can only play with other people that leave the match until you get rid of your 'abandons.' This punishment is beneficial for players that constantly play it as it can get annoying if you lose a match because someone quit however for people that have to go when they have to go it can be unfair because they get penalised a lot and after all it is only a game and it isn't really fair to penalise someone when they are meant to be haing fun. Anyway, the second thing that so many people CANT STAND is the wait. The most I have waited for a match is 20 mins and at the least it takes around 7 mins to find a game and this is all down to slow running servers. You will have to wait around 1 min to join a game on Advanced Warfare PS4 eddition to put this in contrast. This wasted time does build up and you may eventualy find yourself thinking what's the point. Having said this, there are only 2 or 3 (depending whether you are a sweat or not) main negatives for this game and so many other games have so much more faults. I hope you found this useful. Please comment and bye. TCM

game-hours: 465.4
review: Dota 2 is a free to play competitive MOBA game with minor micro transactions (for outfits etc.) by Valve. The game has become the most popular game on Steam and that's for a reason. The gameplay is smooth and easy to learn. The characters are all different and have a lot of variety in them and unlike in League of legends, you don't actually have to unlock all the heroes, you just simply get them all from the get-go. Dota is really easy to get a grasp on...or so it was for me. I've seen some people complain about the game being too difficult and that it has a high learning curve, but I beg to differ. It's easy if you've played games similiar to this in the past. The matches last for about 30-40 minutes on average (my longest match was about 70 minutes), which sometimes prevents me from playing the game if I don't have a lot of time in my hands. So remember to preserve some time before you start a match because disconnecting too many times will get you penalised and you won't be getting any dota points. The community can cause you a problem if you're having trouble dealing with hatred and pubertic Russian virgins (NO OFFENCE) ranting to you for stealing their kill every once and a while. If that is not the case then you should be fine. And of course, not everybody on the internet is mean...you can meet some very nice people there too and the game is at it's best when everyone works together and respects one another. The game is great for online play with friends too. I've played Dota 2 for over a 100 hours and I still try to play it at least once a day. I definitely recommend this game to everyone who's interested...why not it's free and that's all that matters, right... you dweeb. I sincerely thank Valve for giving us yet another amazing game to waste our miserable lifes and hard earned coins in. 9/10!

review: Russia is everywhere,Russia is watching you 10/10
game-hours: 3054.3
review: Well, it seems that i will write this review very carefully becouse, well, i have around 2400 hours on this game. Lets get back to the times when internet cafe's where ruled by Warcraft 3 and CS 1.6 tournaments. These were mostly known games, though when times went by, popularity of Warcraft went down horribly. Then, the light of hope was given to people, the most known mod for Warcraft 3 was released (map, whatever) - Dota Allstars. Becouse of this map/mod, people started to play Warcraft again (even now, there isnt that small of a fanbase that prefers that map more than dota 2 itself). But still, dota 2 is currently the most played game in steam So what is MOBA? This is an RPG-like genre, with the mix of MMORPG and Fighting games, where you use skills to defeat enemy characters on your map. The most common example (and the most hated here) is League of Legends, Heroes of Newerth and Smite (and the upcoming Heroes of the Storm). Basically, you choose your character from the pool (depending on a gamemode). And you must get gold and experience to overthrow enemies. Thats about it. But this game is still alot harder than it seems. Even me, with 2400 hours of gameplay, have lots to learn here. This means this game has an endless learning curve. Adapting, comboing are an example of how endless the possibilites are present in this game. When you start this game for the first time, you will get flamed, blamed and all that , becouse, well, you dont know anything here, so i have an advice to pass the tutorials first then play alot of matches with bots. Lets get back to the game. There is more than 110 heroes (dont call them champions pls), with unique abillities and play style. These heroes have different roles, dependant on the presence in the game, where the hero shines the most, in the beginning of the game, mid-game, or late-game. The game is basically 5 versus 5, the team that gets to destroy the opposing ancient, wins. And thats it, well, tutorials will teach you the rest for beginning. I love how heroes are unique, that you need to counter certain ones, dont let them farm or gank them (damnit, i swore that i wont use unknown words in this review). Even if you play mostly on the same map, you still feel how the game is different every time. So this game is good in any sort of way. Even the items from the store look great on heroes. Well then, bla bla bla... game is great... bla bla bla... BUT... there is one big major problem here... !! I guess most of you know what it means. Russians. Every. Damn. Game. They cant communicate, they blame you and feed (die too much times to enemies). They play on every  server. You see a russian nickname? Then you are like 95 procent doomed. This is the worst problem in the game so far. This will annoy you, this will make you rage, this game will trully make you unstable, becouse of these people. But well, i dont care, i know i will still play this game. Overall... They say drugs are addictive, well, then they didnt play dota 2. This game is great, great, great, every aspect is great, though... Community, especially russians. Damnit... Pros: + Addictive as hell + Endless possibilites + Game is known becouse of the E-Sports. + Most unique heroes in MOBA genre. Cons: - ... - Lousy voice acting (Warlock, Antimage - no difference) - Slow updates, that contain mostly hats (economy items) - Slardar/Zeus/Viper models (friggin' ugly) - Worst trading community i have ever seen ( so much high balling) Final Verdict: 8.5  blyad idi na hui out of 10

review: Cold, harsh, unforgiving, abusive, and immensely rewarding. These are a few of the words you could use to describe DOTA 2's community and gameplay. Don't come in expecting to be coddled by the veterans of this MOBA. It's Trial by Fire, sink or swim, live or die, but what the game lacks in a compassionate backing it more than makes up for in the satisfaction of utterly outplaying the opposing team or coming together at the end to pull off an underdog victory!

review: Dota 2 is truly a game for skilled players and takes true dedication and practice.. I played this game a fair bit, so i have lets say, moderate skills.. I'm a big range guy. But anyways back to the point. Dota 2 is wonderful for a F2P game, and can really bring out the inner gamer in you. Along with its entertaining feel, it can unlock a land of oppurtunities such as the Championships.. This game deserves a whopping 9.5/10 which trasnlates to a gold in my rating system..

game-hours: 2125.8
review: DotA 2 is a MOBA with a large community following! IM sure you have all seen some kind of gameplay whether it be on youtube or anything else. This game sucks for the first 25 hours if you havent played another MOBA style game, beause there are SO many features and skills you have to learn! but I assure you, the first hours of pain are worth the following thousands to come! I have been playing this game on and off for about two years now, as my first MOBA apart from a brief introduction to the WoW DotA. I love it and have tried several MOBA'S since, such as LoL and HoN but never really got into them. DotA 2 has the same old valve skins system where you can buy cosmetic items for your heroes, ranging from a few cents to hundreds of dollars. However unlike LoL you do not need to pay for any hero or in game feature as it is completely FREE! I reccomend picking this game up and sticking to it until you get the hang of it as it is surely worth it. The community in DotA is like what you would expect in any other online game, you get the good and the bad. Hope this helped! 8/10

review: ITS CRAP! anyone looking at this game please read this review! I will explain all the good things about dota 2 first! Its not like league of legends inwhich "IS" spam fest that really at 300 games you can easily have skills equal or better than the so called pros....LOL>league of legends is a very limited and LOW skill bracket game (this comes from having repeditive heroes on mutiple maps (CANNOT BE BALANCE TO MAP), limited movement and interaction with map (dota very flexible map interaction compaired to LOL) and constantly MAKING new CHAMPIONS) being pro at LOL is NOTHING! Dota 2 or dota in general has a very high potenial skill bracket, meaning its easily challenging, exciting and with this self rewarding on victory alone in a good game no matter how many times you play it. Dota 2 heroes are more balanced on capability on MAP farm rate (gold per minute earned by killing random creeps, gold is used for items) control (stoping enemy players, controling the map for team .etc) and start late potenial (no items, Lots of items and how the items syncronize on specific heroes) while league of legends is balanced one way....EVERY HERO MIGHT AS WELL BE THE SAME!!! it gets very boring very fast aspecial once u play dota. NEGATIVES BIG F*(Y*&^KING NEGATIVES! One the community is HOPLESS, (note: if u do not play games to advance in skill or ever actually do well at strategy games! then plz ignor this review u will fit in nicely. For everyone else when playing most of my dota 2 games i find it more pleasant when after the loading screen simply mute everyone else in the game, even in CO-OP games, there is too much internet trash in this community and it isnt the communities fault in truth, the people that run and set up dota have made massive failures with not the game, the game is good, but characteristics with interface and community control that isnt policed at all and others that well just aggravate you. If u can play the game mute everyone every game, never play it with friends and not invest anything but time to play and i mean souly in playing not understanding or skill building then once again, please ignor this review you will be fine, you probly really really like the game for the very very small amount of time you actually play it, because lets face it if thats you than you obviously have other things you would rather be doing. First negative by the makers: for no reason at all on wide internet game play thats based on pointless endless matchmaking inwhich is all dota really is, the makers allow a ALL chat system basis. THIS IS STUPID! (it should be a base setting on profile to allow any chat/chat type period) Imagine the spam you get (again BAD COMMUNITY) if you forgot to or havent figured out how to mute people. Also for the short time after loading in some game types you cannot mute anyone and there is alot of trash that use this to spam aggravating sounds and stupid comments over with MIKES! This happens more than you think it would. The game type is "ability draft" if you are wondering. So advice, ULT-TAB turn your sound OFF until you can mute them. Second, Dota 2 has a reporting system....THAT IS NOT POLICED! Only a true  implements a policing system without policing the F*(&^King system. So on that alone you can imagine how its abused! To be honest if i play dota on a day i make sure to use up all my reports before i stop playing even if my last was a really good game. (Silly but self justice really to answer just how crap i really think dota 2 is and is going to become, after few thousand hours playing the game since beta i have now uninstalled and removed it with no intention of ever getting it back. (Im compeditive and the game JUST TOO MUCH STUPID, the community and set up by makers isnt improving- never will, and doesnt allow for higher skilled casual players that dont just play the game but make an effort to GET good at it to have well fun)).-ADVICE: only ever play self made and party lobby games with friends, never use match making. This can make the game fun. Third Dota has pointless features, such as the profile level system...It was originally a means for aquiring new aesthetic tools for heroes. (every level you get a new item, the item part is now removed and has been for a LONG time! this is all the feature did! (evidence administrator/makers are crap)) fourth reason: Dota 2 has a play and fail to understand before understanding gameplay. Its very unforgiving for new players and even the wiki page doesnt actually tell you all about heroes and their abilities- limits ,etc. there is alot of varibles and stuff in dota which is why it has such a massive potenical skill bracket. (by which i would say 4-5 times greater than league of legends) Fifth and the last one im going to add to review and in my book the F&^%$King worst: There are 2 match making pools verse other players Normal/ Ranked Ranked is player rated, Normal isnt. Dota is like chess, every game is a new beginning every victory or loss is another end. There for it is only natural it would easily aquire a rating or ranking system of some sort. And oh it has......! A TRULY USELESS PIECE OF (*#%^&# IT IS! Chess is only made of 2 componets, the players and their interaction in order of turns. This is why chess can effectively be rated through wins and loses alone. DOTA doesnt have just 2 components, it has legitimately 20 i can think off hand, so MORE than 20. Yet the administrator uses a 2 componet SYSTEM thats again doesnt work and to make it worse it starts at a NOT point zero marker. In other words instead of going up if u win and head back to zero if you lose.... NO! it means you go into negatives and have to continue playing with  TOOLS that literally trap you there. As this rating system is no longer how good you are ("even if your the best on the planet") ITS NOW ALL ABOUT HOW LUCKY YOU ARE THAT YOU DIDNT GET THE "MORE" RETARED TEAM MATES THAT GAME!. So in saying im a compeditive player im sure you can see why im ditching this game. And by the way the ranking system has been coping CRAP since it was released years ago, all over the internet it hasnt improved. (EVIDENCE- adminastrator/makers are CRAP) Now after that you will be asking so why did you play ranked? ANSWER- normal games win or lose i still end up huge (reguardless of hero) (well farmed loss comes as team is useless 90% of time, out played 10% of the time) and winning (80% of the time, vertually on my own efforts. 19% of the time cause maybe 2 or less people on your team want to play with you as in get involved in game play, and 1% of the time thats a good game or at least you liked playing with your team!!!) Ranked games I have a higher chance of getting totally good games (thats win or loss no one gets upset really...IT WAS AWESOME! extimate only 3% of the time this happens, maybe lower) and the basic skill level of all players is higher no just walking threw them anymore. Literally when i play normal games i just see how many kills i can get by 20 mins. (my record 41 as pudge, normal "all pick" game type. I average 15 per game as pudge in my ranked games, im still under 4000 rating the base rating! HOW does this happen anyone that knows dota knows for this example playing strong "pick off" heroes well isnt winning at 30 minutes in the game if that enemy carry thats died 10 times still has alot more farm than your teams free farm carry. "THIS HAPPENED TO ME TOO MUCH!" or supports that think all they have to do is buy a courier and wards!). The sum of DOTA 2 for this review is the community is BAD and why? The administrator/makers are BAD. Dota 2 is a good game but, it is not worth playing.
