game-hours: 1399.2
review: General Run-Down on Dota 2 Before Anyone Starts Real Player-Interactive MATCHES: (PLEASE READ MY FULL REVIEW FOR A BETTER UNDERSTANDING) -GRAB SOME FRIENDS AND PREPARE FOR POTENTIAL LIFE THREATENING SPONTANEOUS MOOD CHANGES- and preferabley make a 5 person group, learn the game as a group. You will have fun, guaranteed for 30min-60min. It all depends on the intriguing mysteries of the MATCH. -THE BEST WAY TO LEARN- is by knowing the different ROLES of the game, there are only a handful that you need to know to start effectivley and if you wish to watch youtube videos on the roles, I am going to list the roles and what they are right here: -Carry - Hero that can become very powerful through amassed gold earnings spent on buying items and gaining experience. Carries are very item dependent which requires them to be supported by support heroes very early on. A Carry scales tremendously higher than other types the later the game drags on due to a majority of their abilities being weak in the beginning but becoming super effective as they get items and experience. This allows them to easily or competitively punish enemy heroes throughout the game. There are 2 types of Carries and these are their most effective time constraints to be ready to kick some  : Mid-game Carry (15min-30min) and Late-game Carry (30-40 min+). Late-game Carries scale higher than mid-game ones making them more powerful. -Support - A hero that is generally well rounded in sustainability, presence and survival at the start of the game due to his abilities. This kind of hero buys wards, couriers, healing salves, mana potions, dust of appearance and much more important items with their gold. These purchased items are normally saved in the support's stash in case a Carry is in need of the purchased item. This helps the team's Carry or Carries to be relieved of that obligation so the Carry can focus on spending their gold towards becoming a more powerful hero as quickly as possible (this is crucial). A support will protect his carry at all costs using the supporting players best judgement. The carry is always more important than any other heroes. -Nuker - A hero that has 2 or more learned abilities that are naturally-powerful (normally magic based) very early on in the game through the leveling process. These abilities Nuker's have allow them to deliver a staggering amount of damage to an enemy hero or heroes more frequently and effectively than others. Nuker's are less item-dependent in this way, but they scale lower as the game drags on compared to carries. There are a few items a hero can purchase with their gold to lower the magical damage of these heroes. (Namely, my favorite, normally bought by a support, is a Pipe of Insight). A Nuker can act as a support in some games, it's entirely up to the player. -Semi-Support or Semi-carry - Both terms are the same and used intermittently. These heroes can be hybrids of all 3 combined rolls (Carry, Nuker, Support). People play this role effectively in some games. This is a completely experimental role with some foundation to fall back on through player experience and their knowledge of Dota 2. -THIS IS THE PROPER WAY TO GET FAMILIAR WITH THE GAME- play against Artificially Intelligent BOTS in MATCHES to grasp an understanding of multiple scenarios and different heroes potentials (there are over 100 heroes all free to choose from) before you detriment players like myself. AI BOT MATCHES come in all skill levels, from easy to completely unfair (unfair is really really really hard mode). Once you can put up a hell of a fight against unfair mode AI BOT MATCHES with different heroes you like and you can play all three roles effectively. You will then be ready to kick some  in real games against real players with your friends (or by yourself). If you do not prepare in this way, you are ruining other people's matches, as well as getting your  handed to you the whole time while becoming frustrated that you never listened to me. -CONS (They are in every game, no matter what, but this community has numerous different age groups so keep that in mind) -PEOPLE- will curse at you, talk down on you, and blame you for either your wrong doing or their own (I try constructive criticism, but the PLAYERS IN THE COMMUNITY DO NOT CARE TO BETTER THEMSELVES or they already see themselves as perfect players). There is an in-game mute option for voice and text chat!!! All of this comes with the territory. It is a toxic community, hence why I mentioned to either make some friends or start with real life ones. -MATCHMAKING IS BROKEN- what I mean by this is, players with 1000+ hours in Dota 2 are matched and teamed with players that have minimal hours in comparison which henders both veterans and noobs in skill advancement, as well  the thrill and fun of a competitive hearty and hard fought match. -DOTA 2- is now restricting certain in-game earned cosmetic items such as outfits, wards, mounts, etc....from being sold on the open market in Steam for Steam Credit (Money). This is a huge deal to me, and maybe others, because the open market is freedom, freedom to game and earn while having fun. -PRO'S -THIS GAME IS VERY REWARDING- Every game is different from start to end. The mystery of unknown outcomes and unknown hero combinations is very intriguing, it draws you in for more. You can spend 300+ hours in Dota 2 and will never come across every combination of heroes during that time, nor every different start to end matches. You will inevitabley start receiving cosmetic items at the end of matches where you only played against real players and not AI Bots. Those cosmetics can be anything for random heroes or other perks of the game, every item is completely random every time, some could be duplicates after several hours, but there are new ones quite frequently. I hope you enjoy this game. Take every thing I said and soak it in. Dota 2 will take you on a roller coaster journey and every thing in between. This includes but is not limited to: -throwing up a lot -cursing a lot -blowing up like a pressurized steam container....a lot -feeling so relieved you almost want to cry about how relieved you are.... "even the small victories, yes, the small ones" -and so, so, soooo much more. HAVE FUN

game-hours: 1052.5
review: They say, before concluding with, You suck. They're not wrong: for the first dozen hours or so, you'll be bombarded with too much information and an often unforgiving community of extremely competitive players. But if you persevere, Dota 2 becomes one of the most rewarding and tense team-based multiplayer experiences anywhere in gaming. A fantastic free-to-play model. Dota 2 has become notorious even among its MOBA peers for its difficulty  and thats totally justified. Its a double-edged sword that leads to both a terrifying introduction and a world-class game at the highest levels. You should not expect to have fun your first day playing... or even your first week, maybe months. Dota 2 is a deeply layered construct of systems, and to survive you need to understand every single one and how they interact with one another. Everything from learning to work as a member of a coordinated team to the counter-intuitive practice of killing your own AI units to deny the enemy experience points and gold theyd get from doing it themselves, and understanding the effects of hundreds of abilities like Bloodseekers Rupture (which deals huge damage with every step you take) is a big barrier to entry. Even figuring out which of the 108 heroes fits you best is a time-consuming challenge. Your learning has just begun when you've settled on what roles, heroes, and builds suit you best  you also have to adapt based on what other players choose. If the other team plays a Riki, you need to compensate with an emphasis on detection. Go up against Bloodseeker and his hideously powerful Rupture will force you to carry around a Town Portal Scroll to get home. Shop System: Only cosmetic enhancements, almost all of which are created by the community. Tournament goodies (such as tickets for viewing live events) are for sale. Theres not a single paid on the in-game balance, and thats great! In short words: Dota 2 pits two teams of five players against each other. mix of strategy and RPG, skill management and tactical gameplay. 108 heroes, each with their own style and combat abilities. most heroes have 4 skills that can be increased in power by levelling up by killing enemys. there are over 120 items to choose from within each game, each with their own ways to power up your stats and active abilities. creeps that charge down the game's three lanes, and the player controlled heroes on the opposite team. Theres a huge time investment before you can enjoy a game. it creates a playing field where skill and teamplay is top priority.Overall, Dota 2 is a pretty hard game which is hard to enjoy. So I'm giving it a whopping 9 / 10

game-hours: 72.5
review: Dota 2 - is a multiplayer game in the genre of real-time strategy with RPG elements. Is an extension of the world-famous fashion DotA (Defense of the Ancients - Defense of the Ancients) to the game Warcraft III. Maud on so much popular that the game industry has a new genre - Action-RTS, with lots of "clones", both successful and not. Gameplay is a competition between the two teams, consisting of three or five persons. One team is the bright side, the second - the Dark. Each side, a different set of characters. Each player can only control one business unit or, in other words, his hero. In the course of the passing game hero gains experience, thereby increasing their level. He can also earn gold. In addition, he regularly receives small amounts from its base, it can mine gold by killing enemies. Murder heroes brings significantly more gold than the destruction of enemy creeps. In addition, the hero can collect and buy a variety of items that affect its strength and development, as well as provide additional benefits. In the course of the game have to fight not only with the opposing party, but also beat the regular attack creeps, computer controlled. The main task - keeping the defense of its own base, destroy the enemy's main building base side. In addition, the characters can be dispersed throughout the territory and fight with neutral monsters.
game-hours: 518.4
review: All gamers probably already know what Dota 2 but I going to give my ups & downs anyway + I really like the graphic, it's sort of cartoonish which gives a more casual feeling. + Free 2 Play (not Pay 2 Play) Guaranteed + Valve update the game a lot (hopefully to the better) - Extremely long learning curve for beginners. - Extremely toxic community. This is probably the biggest downside, It doesn't matter what you do, place a ward at a bad pos, miss a spell, don't join your allies quick enough in battle, don't call an enemy. People will get furios on you. - MMR (matchmaking rank) queue is broken. English only queue doesn't have any affect, same with the regions.. Pick english only and EU West and you will 8/10 times end up against or with Russian players. No offense to any Russian but there is a huge communication problem when people can't talk the same language. Some kind of google translate in-game could solve this problem, or help at least. In the long term, this game and its lack of a toxic community, language issues I can only recommend this game to beginners who have friends to play with. Play this on your own and you might experience a very tragic gameplay. The game itself is however a 9/10

game-hours: 779.9
review: Defense Of The Ancients, or DOTA for short is an MMO RTS RPG game with about 100+ characters to choose from i n each match, which average out to be 30 - 45 minutes each. This is not your average FPS, Racing, or Open World game that takes about an hour to get into. Alot of time and concentration must be invested into this vast experience that can define the lives of many individuals. The training system in this game or tutorial if u must only teaches the absolute basics: such as how to move around or how to attack and use your various abilities. This proves only to be the tip of the iceberg as alot more depth and detail is in store for a new playeror a "scrub/newb" (as many DOTA community players would call them) Anyways this wasnt much of a review as it was a warning. Dont get into this game and go play online if u havent the faintest idea of how the game is played. Please consult many reviews and play practice matches with AI before going into an actual game with other players, becoz DOTA is a team game, and if one link of the chain falls loose, the whole thing collapses into ruin, not to mention that you'll also  the hell out of alot of people by doing this XD.

game-hours: 500.3
review: many people argue about wether dota 2 is better or league of legends. i play both (Dota more) and i wouldnt say dota is better. there are many differences between the games and the main one is strategy. in league of legends vision is required and map awareness is essential however in dota, position matters a lot more than lol. since the 4th minute on, in dota everybody is ganking around the place and tp supports are coming in to survive ganks. in lol it is a lot simpler. farm, kill, push mid. in dota you have to think, constantly watch the map, counter draft, counter build, position yourself and rotate correspondingly. in lol there are many lacking features such as, vision obstruction (hills and trees) missing, diverse range of active items and ability types. if you want a simple, just play game go for lol, but you are a a strategic player and look for osmething that truly tests your skill id recommend dota 2.

This is probably the best free to play game i have ever had the pleasure of spenidng 800 hours on and ill tell you why. Every game needs to make money but Dota is fair about it. Spending money in game for a mythical set or an immortal weapon doesn't increase your stats or anything, its just cosmetic and that what i love about it. Games like Robocraft people pay for OP weapon and in Dota, its all about your skill, teamwork and wit verses the other teams. game-hours: 2417.6
review: <3<3
game-hours: 1853.1
review: First of all, played both LoL and Dota 2. I won't say which one is better, none of them is. Whilst LoL is much more noob-friendly, Dota 2 is way harder to get good about. We have about 100 characters, where every of them got different skills. The same goes for items. As long as you won't get to know all of their effects then you'll sure gonna have a hard time starting even a bit. There is also a way to change the way your characters look, it can make you look original but you have to pay/get lucky in order to do so. 1900 Hours isn't really too much on this game, Realized how long I've played in summary, and thus I know well how to play. First of all, we don't need to be Total Pro Players to have fun in this game. There are modes like Team Deathmatch, Ability Draft(The greatest out of unusual ones, where you can make HyperCarries or PermaDisablers), All pick(classic),Ranked matches, Random Draft, and so on. 8+ in total.Every of them gives a different gameplay. So in summary: + Wide variety of modes. + A lot of options to customise appearance of your characters. + Well-Developed variety of characters and their skills, every single is original in both appearance and usage. + Eye and PC-Friendly engine, most PC will be able to run this game. + It's Free, you don't need to pay for heroes, unlike in most MOBA games. + Quite helpful tutorial, althought It won't teach you how to be "Pro". - Hard to place first steps - A lot of russians on other than Russian server(Not being a racist but a lot of these players don't even use english!) - Snowballing effect is a real pain. Recommended for every player that likes MOBA games/or is bored of LoL(Like I was). ^^

review: Vi is the CLEAARLY the best champ in Dota FACT But no seriously really good game, If you've played another Moba before definatley give this a swing, it is a bit of an accuired taste so you may end up quitting it but just keep at it. There are some really cool characters (Luna) and some not so cool characters (Timbersaw is lame). It takes some time to learn and most of the time you cant understand the people you are playing with BUT THATS FIIIIIIIINE just bring friends and you'll have more fun. Most people compare this game to League of Legends and after playing Leauge an IMMENSE amount I can honestly say one isn't better than the other, while looking simmilar they are both very different games and that shows while playing them, so if you go in expecting League you'll come out dissapointed, I still enjoy League more but that is due to Vi being a god tier waifu. My absolute FAVORITE thing about Dota 2 is the access to skins, which in this game aren't exactly skins more just peices to them, and as a customization junkie OOOH do I love it. So in the end if you are thinking of trying Dota 2 i'd say absolutley go for it, it's a very fun game that takes some time to learn but there are guides and such you can use to help. 9/10 Vi has a sweet butt

game-hours: 498.9
review: "MOBA's, the future of gaming" said someone once, this game is basically that... DotA 2 in a nutshell: The game is way to addictive, you get latched on and lose track of time, seeing the extent of the matches (the normal one lasting 40-50 mins), it's got a massive pro-scene and if you have friends to play it's just even more fun. Pros: -Has a HUGE variety of choices of heroes, builds, cosmetics and styles to play. -The competion in the game is outsanding. -It's an addictive game, which in my opinion is good. -It makes you wanna keep playing due to it's ranking system and be the top up there. Cons: -The game is very rage-inducing. -There are alot of connection issues due to the fact that Dota cant separate people from their servers, for example SA playing on NA servers. -The community is very "strict" in the way that, you die twice in-a-row, but have five kills, your a "feeder, noob, etc." So, to recap all this, DotA is the perfect game for all you try-hards out there looking for a challenge, something I wouldn't put as a pro or a con would be that the learning curve is so very steep. Takes more then a month to learn the game, ever for veteran MOBA players, the pro-scene is ony getting better. Final Score: 9/10

game-hours: 398.2
review: At first I thought that MOBAs in general were terrible, I played the DOTA 2 tutorial and played ten matches then uninstalled the game. I really didnt like playing the game because every time I played I was shouted at and put in low priority. About a year later after my friends insisted that I play I started afresh and managed to quickly find my feet and DOTA 2 is now one of my favourite all time games. The steep learning curve makes DOTA 2 hard to get into but after you start understanding tactics and mastering characters it becomes an amazing game. The hundreds of characters, items, playstyles, etc. make every game fresh and exciting. If you manage to make your way out of the (noob/pinoy) bracket of players then suddenly the game opens up with possibilities and becomes one of the best games that I have ever played. It will keep you entertained for years and years.

review: The game is okay, but I am naturally a reflexive gamer, not a strategy gamer. So in an FPS gamer's point of view, this game is fun but get's boring really quick. Takes a long time to get to the action, but the action barely lasts 10 seconds (unless you have a tp scroll or whatever it's called). Variety of characters is good. But I find that one map get's really boring. Some might disagree with what I say. Heck, a lot of people will disagree with what I say, especially considering the kind of community this game has. Majority of them are uncooperative, unhospitable, or trolls. All in all, good game, just doesn't really catch my interest, and horrible community. This game is only fun if you have friends to play with.
